loans.name: Raja

texts.en: Raja is a 44 year old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD so that she can buy new doors for her home. She would like to do this so that she can improve the condition of her house. Raja prefers that her photo is not on the internet, the photo is of her husband.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Isra

texts.en: Isra is a 21 year old married woman from Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to buy accessories and other products such as hair proucts which she will sell at her shop. She would like to improve and expand her current project selling these products so that she can increase her income. Since Isra is under 30 years old her loan is considered a youth loan. loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BADEGNA  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TAGAN, un des villages de SELINGUE, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide   FATOU, 2 eme debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de TAGAN, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

Since Ahmad is under 30 year old,his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Née vers 1990 à FARABANA, Fatoumata vit avec son  enfant et son époux dans une  famille monogame dans le quartier N’tentou de la ville de Ouelessebougou. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer dans les études,  très vite Fatoumata s’est  intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente des habits en provenance de BAMAKO et des pagnes wax de Lomé (au Togo).    
Fatoumata est à son premier  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  50 pièces de pagnes wax  auprès des  grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché et dans les foires  environnantes (Sido, Sélingué, Keleya et Tièlé)  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Fatoumata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.

loans.use: Achat d’habits

loans.name: Yelen Group

texts.fr:
Yelen est un groupe de l’association Benkadi de Ouelessebougou. Il regroupe 6 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, sont mariées et mère d’au moins cinq enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de d’habits et de la restauration à l’image de Fanta qui est la première personne assise de la gauche vers la droite. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Ouelessebougou dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali).  Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Fanta, excelle dans la préparation et vente de nourritures. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, quelque sacs de riz et des condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes (poivre, tomate, oignon,  choux).  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.

loans.use: Achat d’ingrédients pour la restauration

loans.name: Mamadoudiawara Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 27 femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé Mai 2010. Elles sont toutes issues du même quartier et ont une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Sountou (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette,  âgée de 55 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 07  enfants (2 Garçons et 5 filles).
Elle a une place au marché ou elle achète et vend du poisson frais, elle a une expérience de 03 ans dans ce domaine.

Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en poisson frais dans la petite côte pour la revente au marché central.
-	Elle achète les 03 paniers de poisson frais à 45 000F Cfa pour le revendre au détail à 75 000F Cfa
-	Elle achète aussi le panier de poisson fumé à 20 000F Cfa pour le revendre au détail à 30000F Cfa
-	Pour le transport, la manutention et la glace elle paie 10 000F Cfa
Chaque semaine après déduction de ses charges liées à son commerce elle se retrouve avec un bénéfice net hebdomadaire de 25 000F Cfa en moyenne.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner et  de payer une partie de la scolarité de ces enfants.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 27 women who are very active in their village bank which was created in May 2010.  The women are all from the same neighborhood and have a good understanding between them.  Their main activity is small business.  

Sountou (sitting on the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower.  She is 55 years old, married, and the mother of seven children (two sons and five daughters).  She has a stand in the market where she buys and sells fresh fish.  She has three years experience in this field.

With this loan, Sountou plans to stock up with fresh fish on la Petite Côte (a popular stretch of the Senegalese coast) to re-sell in the central market.  She will buy three baskets of fresh fish at 45,000 francs, to re-sell retail at 75,000 francs and one basket of smoked fish at 20,000 francs, to re-sell at 30,000 francs.  She will also pay 10,000 francs for transportation, handling and ice.  

Every week, after subtracting her business expenses, Sountou makes an average net profit of 25,000 francs.

The profits she makes in her business will allow Sountou to save up and cover some of her children's school expenses.

loans.use: to stock up with fresh fish on the 'Petite Côte' (a popular stretch of the Senegalese coast) to re-sell in the central market

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr:
Mr  Ibrahima âgé de 34 ans marié et père de deux enfants, tailleur de profession  depuis  15 ans confectionne et vend des habits et des draps. 
Mr Ibrahima sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des tissus, les confectionner puis les vendre afin de satisfaire la demande des clients. L’argent issu de ces ventes lui permettra de nouveau  d’acheter  des tissus, les confectionner et de les vendre, de prendre en charge les besoins quotidiens de la maison, de rembourser l’argent emprunté.
Mr Ibrahima  a comme projet future l’acquisition d’un local pour son atelier.
texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahima - 34 years old, married and a father of two, a tailor by trade for the past 15 years - makes and sells clothing and linens.

Mr. Ibrahima is seeking this loan to purchase fabrics, prepare them, then sell them in order to meet customer demand. The money that comes from these sales will allow him to again purchase fabrics, prepare them and sell them, as well as to see to the daily needs of the house and to pay back the borrowed money.

As a future project, Mr. Ibrahima plans to acquire a premises for his studio.

loans.use: To make and sell clothing and linens.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 58 years old and lives in Mobod, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children. Gloria has a business buying and selling dried fish and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of PHP 13,000 to to have additional working capital. 

Gloria has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Gloria hopes to expand her business to nearby barangays.

loans.use: to have additional working capital.

loans.name: Hellem Micheal

texts.en:
Hellem Michael is a 30-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has three children between the ages of 5 and 9. All of them go to school. 

Hellem runs a general store and has been in business for five years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan from other clients. She is taking a loan of 3,000 SDG to purchase onoins, tomatoes, cabbage, and many other things. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years, Hellem would like to open many branches of her business and employ others. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Hellem  says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through Kiva.

loans.use: for buying items like, onions, beans, and maize.

loans.name: Victoire Group

texts.fr:
Victoire est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Koko de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 46 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les pagnes, du bois de chauffe, du charbon de bois,  etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur seizième  prêt de groupe. 
Lydie  est un membre du groupe qui fait l’achat vente du bois e chauffe et du charbon de bois, elle est la première personne à droite.   
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des chargements de bois de chauffe et de charbon de bois.  Elle se procure de ces produits au marché de Koutiala et dans les villages environnants. Elle vend en détail et au comptant à la maison à une clientèle diverse et variée. Elle est très sollicitée par sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses articles. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Victoire comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 110 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Lydie  compte réaliser 132 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter leur fonds de commerce.

loans.use: Achat du bois de chauffe et charbon de bois

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Djiguiya est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Darsalam II de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 47 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 1 enfant.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les céréales, du poisson, de la mangue, des condiments alimentaires  et du savon. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur dixième et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Aïchata est le membre du groupe en shale rouge, qui fait la fabrication de savon.   
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de l’huile, du bois de chauffe et de la potasse, des ingrédients indispensables pour faire du savon traditionnels pouvant être utilisé pour la lessive et pour la toilette.  Elle se procure de ces produits au marché de Koutiala. Elle vend son savon en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché à une clientèle diverse et variée, elle est très sollicitée et appréciée à Koutiala et environs. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djiguiya comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 55 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Aïchata   compte réaliser  65 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter leurs fond de commerce.

loans.use: Achat  d’ingrédients pour fabriquer le savon traditionnel

loans.name: Honronya  3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Honronya 3 sont mariés dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Kondia dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. 
Dans le but d’avoir des intrants agricoles à leur disposition en début d’hivernage et d’avoir de la main d’œuvre, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe vont cultiver de l’arachide, du mil, du gombo et du niébé.
Madame Bintou (femme au milieu parmi des femmes debouts) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs d’engrais et utiliser la main d’œuvre pour labourer et sarcler son champ de mil, de niébé et de gombo. Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à la foire de Ségou et en main d’œuvre avec l’association des jeunes du village. Avec une superficie de 2 hectares, elle espère produire  6 sacs de mil, 30 sacs de gombo, 1 sac de niébé et des fanes. 
En plus des fanes de niébé, une partie de la production du mil, du gombo et de niébé sera vendue pour prendre en charge les besoins du foyer en produits de premières nécessités et le reste serait auto consommée en famille. 
Madame Bintou a pour objectif d’assurer les soins de santé de ses enfants et l’auto suffisance alimentaire dans son foyer.

loans.use: Achat d’engrais et utilisation de la main d’œuvre

loans.name: Honronya  4 Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 41 ans et 3 enfants, les dix membres du groupe Honronya 4 vivent toutes dans le village de Kondia dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. Dans le but d’avoir des intrants agricoles à leur disposition en début d’hivernage et faire recours à la main d’œuvre, elles ont rejoint Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe vont cultiver l’arachide, le mil, le gombo et le niébé.
Madame Kadia (femme en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter deux sacs d’engrais, faire le labour de son champ de mil et de gombo. Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à la foire de Ségou, Cinzana gare et en main d’œuvre avec l’association des jeunes du village. Avec une superficie de 1 hectare, elle espère produire 2 sacs de mil, une vingtaine de baignoire de gombo,  2 sacs de niébé et des fanes. En plus des fanes de niébé, une partie de la production du mil, du gombo et de niébé sera vendue pour gérer les petites dépenses du foyer au quotidien tandis que le reste serait auto consommée en famille.

loans.use: Achat d’engrais et faire recours à la main d’oeuvre

loans.name: Nanou

texts.fr:
Madame Nanou est âgée de  56 ans environ, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle  vit dans une grande famille  avec son époux, sa coépouse et leurs enfants  dans la ville de Koutiala. 
Madame Nanou n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école, raison pour laquelle elle s’est basée sur le commerce depuis à bas âge qu’elle apprit auprès de sa maman. Elle excelle dans la vente de Sounbala, un des condiments essentiels des femmes maliennes, depuis plusieurs années. Elle est très sollicitée par sa clientèle, car elle reçoit des commandes importantes en provenance de plusieurs villes du Mali et des pays voisins. 
Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle, Nanou rentre en partenariat avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 8 ans. Après 3 prêts dans un groupe (prêt solidaire) elle est à son 7ème prêt individuel et tous ses prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 15 sacs de 100Kg de noix de néré auprès des villageoises lors des foires hebdomadaires de la ville de Koutiala. Elle fait transformer ces noix de néré en Sounbala pour ensuite les vendre  à Koutiala, Bamako, Kayes, à une clientèle constituée de femmes généralement, au comptant et souvent à crédit.  
Elle compte générer un bénéfice mensuel de 125.000FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement du prêt de Soro Yiriwaso, contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: Achat de noix de Néré

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a married man with five children in addition to two other dependants. George deals in planting seedlings in nursery beds, particulary coffee seedlings. He has been advanced a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to restock seedlings for sale. The client says there's an urgent need and demand for coffee seedlings in his area and he needs to stock more for sale. He hopes to expand his nursery beds from the profits he will make from the sales. He is very hard working.

loans.use: To restock seedlings for sale

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en: Jalia is aged 37 and is charged with the responsibility of looking after her five children. She has been operating a retail shop for four years.  Customers not paying on time is the major challenge that hinders her business.  Her dream is to build a permanent home and move her business to a more permanent location.  Jalia requested a loan to buy general merchandise such as soap and salt to sell.

loans.use: buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillerma tiene 54 años. Desde hace 16 años vive en casa de su suegra, ubicada en la localidad de Huancayo. Ahí conformó su familia, junto a su esposo Emilio y sus tres hijos, de los cuales, ahora sólo vive con una de ellas, Elizabeth.

Durante las mañanas dedica su tiempo en el cuidado de un baño público que se encuentra ubicado en una zona céntrica de la ciudad. Hace 3 años comenzó con la administración de ese negocio. Ya por las tardes, comienza su principal ingreso económico; desde hace 15 años empezó con la venta de queso, yogurt, mantequilla, manjar blanco, miel de abeja, turrones, tortas de leche, dulces y bebidas de todo tipo. En todo este tiempo logró obtener muchos clientes, por ese motivo ya no camina mucho, sabe a qué clientes tiene que visitar y algunas ocasiones entrega a crédito, pues tiene la confianza de que le pagarán. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Las líderes del centro” y este es su octavo crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo que recibe de parte de su asociación, pues ahora podrá mejorar su negocio. Promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que quiere continuar trabajando con su asociación.
Guillerma invertirá este dinero en la compra de dulces, bebidas y productos lácteos como mantequilla y yogurt, para los clientes que constantemente le hacen pedidos.
texts.en:
Guillerma is 54 years old.  For 16 years she has lived in the house of her mother-in-law, located in the town of Huancayo.  There she formed her family with her husband Emilio and their three children.  Now she lives with only one of her children, Elizabeth.

During the mornings she spends her time as a public bathroom attendant in the city center.  She started doing this three years ago.  During the afternoons, she starts workng at her main job.  Fifteen years ago she started selling cheese, yogurt, butter, manjar blanco (a type of caramel sauce or pudding), honey, nougats, cakes, sweets and a variety of beverages.

During this time she succeeded in building a strong clientele, and for this reason she no longer needs to sell door-to-door.  She knows that customers will visit and on some occasions she extends credit, as she has the confidence that they will pay her.  She belongs to the group "Las líderes del centro” and this is her eighth loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the support that she gets from the organization, since now she will be able to grow her business.  

She promises to be punctual with her payments since she wants to continue working with the organization.  Guillerma will invest the money in the purchase of sweets, beverages and dairy products such as butter and yogurt for those customers who are constantly placing orders.

loans.use: to buy sweets, beverages and dairy products to sell.

loans.name: Mariana Marlene

texts.es: Mariana Marlene de 40 años de edad ,casada con tres hijos menores de edad,tiene tres años de tener el negocio el cual esta ubicado en el mercado orienta de managua, actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de comida, el negocio lo inicio como una necesidad de tener una herramienta de trabajo para la mantencion de sus hijos, en la actulidad Mariana ha crecido en clientela  gracias al buen servicio que ofrece a sus clientes, y el apoyo que fundacion leon 2000 le ha brindado, del financiamiento compra productos para elaborar sus comidas como: arroz, frijoles, carne de res y pollo, verduras, aceite entre otros.
texts.en: Mariana Marlene, age 40, is married and with three young children, has had her business for the past three years, which is located in the eastern market in Managua.  The business activity which she does is food sales, and the business is something she started out of the need for a means of keeping up with her children's expenses.  Currently, Mariana has grown her clientele thanks to the good service she offers to her customers, and with the help that Fundacion Leon 2000 has given her, she will be able to buy products to make her foods like rice, beans, beef and chicken, vegetables, oil, and other items.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, beef and chicken, vegetables, oil, and other items.

loans.name: Hort

texts.en:
Hort is 56 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and running a food store for more than two years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Her daughter is employed in a cosmetics shop and earns about $5 per day. 

Hort is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase seeds and fertilizer to use for cultivating rice. In addition, part of this money will be used for hiring farm workers to help cultivate the rice. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her younger child earn a higher education. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Kay

texts.en:
Kay is 54 years old. She is married and blessed with a son in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been making creels (wicker baskets) to sell for more than four years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband and her son are construction workers who earn about $8 each day. 

Kay is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase timber to build a new house. This purchase will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run a groceries store at home to generate additional income to financially support her family.

loans.use: buy timber to build a new house

loans.name: Mony

texts.en:
Mony is 32 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating cassavas and selling groceries for more than three years, earning approximately $12 each day. Her husband is a policeman who earns about $6 daily. 

Mony is requesting a loan of $600 to pay for the expenses of hiring farm workers to cultivate the cassavas. In the future, she would like to expand her groceries store and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: hire workers to cultivate her cassavas crop

loans.name: Santo Domingo Group

texts.es:
El comité Santo Domingo  se formo con la unión de varias vecinas de la comunidad de la ciudad de San Pedro, ellas están en el primer ciclo, y quieren Salir adelante por medio del trabajo de todas ellas.
Ilse es lavandera y comenta que siempre está con mucho trabajo, ya que  la mayoría de sus vecinos siempre le acercan mucho trabajo y de esa forma se gana la vida honradamente. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y algún día poder tener una gran lavandería y también poder dar trabajo a otros.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de lavandinas, jabones, aromatizantes, suavizantes y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The committee named “Santo Domingo” was formed by several neighbors from a community in the city of San Pedro.  They are participating in their first loan cycle.  All of them want to excel in their work.  

Ilse provides laundry services and says that she always has plenty of work.  Most of her neighbors always bring her work, so she is able to earn an honest living.  Her goal is to continue working and to someday have a large laundry establishment where she can provide jobs to others.  

Ilse is requesting a loan in order to buy cleaning agents, soaps, fragrances, softeners, and other supplies so that she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy cleaning agents, soaps, fragrances, softeners, and other supplies.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en: Thanh is 48 years old. She has two children whom are studying in secondary school. She raises pig and sells cooked food in the market for a living. From her business, she gains 4,200,000 VND a month. She has taken part in crediting program of SEDA from 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to make cooked food to sell in the market. The benefit will be used for enlarge her pigsty.

loans.use: to make cooked food to sell in the market. The benefit will be used for enlarge her pigsty.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Phon is 46 years old. She is married and lives with her seven children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling Khmer noodles for more than seven years, earning approximately $3 each day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $3 daily. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $9 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Phon is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase farmland for cultivating rice. This money will help her to run a new business and generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase farmland for cultivating rice

loans.name: Sa Aem

texts.en:
Sa Aem is 38 years old. She is married and lives with her three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than five years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband runs a music equipment rental business. He earns about $9 each day. One of her children is employed in the garment factory as well. He earns about $3 daily. 

Sa Aem is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase construction materials to build a bathroom and toilet. This money will help her provide hygienic living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a bathroom and toilet

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en:
Oeurn is 66 years old and lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is widowed and blessed with one son. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening animals for more than 20 years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her son is a garment worker who earns about $4 each day.

Oeurn is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build up the land around her house with earth to prevent flooding.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en:
Rorn is 39 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband (who is shown in the picture) is a construction worker who earns about $3 each day. One of her children is a security guard who earns about $3 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Rorn is requesting a loan of $500 per day. This purchase would enable her to use the  money saved on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom is 26 years old. She is married and blessed with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than seven years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband (who is shown in the picture) helps her run the business. 

Sokhom is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase jars to use for distilling alcohol. This money will help her run a new business and earn extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a small pig farm and build a bathroom.

loans.use: to purchase jars to use for distilling alcohol

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly is 39 years old. She has two children whom are in primary and secondary school. She transports construction materials and raise pigs for a living. She gets 4,300,000 VND from her jobs per month. She has taken part in crediting program of SEDA from 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to buy car and some others vehicle to transport construction material.

loans.use: to buy car and some others vehicle to transport construction material.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Hai is 44 years old. She has two children whom are in secondary and high school. She transports construction materials and raise pigs for a living. She has done these job for 8 years and gained from them 4,700,000 VND. She has taken part in crediting program of SEDA from 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to build pigsty and buy food for pig. Then she hopes the benefit would be afforded enough for her children’s education fees.

loans.use: to build pigsty and buy food for pig. Then she hopes the benefit would be afforded enough for her children’s education fees.

loans.name: Mo

texts.en: Mo is 43 years old. She has three children. Two little one is studying at school. The older one is adult and has his job. She sells cooked food in the market for a living. She has done this job for 7 years and gained from it 4,300,000 VND. She has taken part in crediting program of SEDA from 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to enlarge her food stall in the market. Then she hopes the benefit would be afforded enough for her children’s education fees.

loans.use: to enlarge her food stall in the market. Then she hopes the benefit would be afforded enough for her children’s education fees.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan is 33 years old. She has two children whom are studying at school. She raises pigs and be a worker in a factory for a living. She gets from her jobs 3,800,000 VND per month. She has taken part in crediting program of SEDA from 2011. The last cycle, she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 6,944,000 VND to upgrade her pigsty and buy food for pigs. Then she hopes the benefit would be afforded enough for rebuilding her house.

loans.use: to upgrade her pigsty and buy food for pigs. Then she hopes the benefit would be afforded enough for rebuilding her house.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Hien is 52 years old. She has two children whom are adult. She sells pork in the market for a living. She has done this job for 8 years and gained from it 3,800,000 VND. She has taken part in crediting program of SEDA from 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to enlarge her pork stall in the market. Then she will use the benefit for opening her child’s construction material store.

loans.use: to enlarge her pork stall in the market. Then she will use the benefit for opening her child’s construction material store.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy is 43 years old. She has two children whom are studying at school. She raises chickens and ducks for a living. She has done this job for 6 years and gained from it 4,200,000 VND. She has taken part in crediting program of SEDA from 2009. The last cycle, she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to raise ducks’ egg for selling. Then she will use the benefit for affording her children’s education fees.

loans.use: to raise ducks’ egg for selling. Then she will use the benefit for affording her children’s education fees.

loans.name: Thom's Group

texts.en:
Thom is 32 years old. She has three children whom are studying at school. She raises pigs and sells iron. She has done this job for 10 years and gained from it 3,600,000 VND. She has taken part in crediting program of SEDA from 2008. The last cycle, she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to raise pigs for selling. Then she will use the benefit for affording her children’s education fees.
 Nghi is 43 years old. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to raise pigs. 
 Tuan is 38 years old. He wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to raise chicken’s eggs.
 Yen is 19 years old. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VNd to sell fresh fruits in the market.

loans.use: to raise pigs for selling. Then she will use the benefit for affording her children’s education fees.

loans.name: Tinh

texts.en: Tinh is 63 years old. She has four children whom are all adult. She raises pigs and poultry. She has done this job for 21 years and gained from it 4,000,000 VND. She has taken part in crediting program of SEDA from 2009. The last cycle, she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to raise pigs for selling. Then she will use the benefit for enlarging her farm of pigs and poultry.

loans.use: to raise pigs for selling. Then she will use the benefit for enlarging her farm of pigs and poultry.

loans.name: Hanh's Group

texts.en:
Hanh is 26 years old. She has a little baby. She is a carpenter. She gains from it 4,000,000 VND per month. She has taken part in crediting program of SEDA from 2011. The last cycle, she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to make more furniture to sell. Then she will use the benefit for enlarging her carpentry studio and raising her children up.
 Quyet is 50 years old. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to raise pigs.

loans.use: to make more furniture to sell. Then she will use the benefit for enlarging her carpentry studio and raising her children up.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en: Nga is 53 years old. She has two children whom are adult. She has a grocery store for a living. She gains from it 3,900,000 VND per month. She has taken part in crediting program of SEDA from 2008. The last cycle, she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to enlarge her grocery store.

loans.use: to enlarge her grocery store.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Oanh is 22 years old. She has a little baby and a child whom is studying at school. She is a carpenter. She gains from it 4,500,000 VND per month. She has taken part in crediting program of SEDA from 2009. The last cycle, she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to make more furniture to sell. Then she will use the benefit for raising her children up and rebuilding her house.

loans.use: to make more furniture to sell. Then she will use the benefit for raising her children up and rebuilding her house.

loans.name: Hau

texts.en: Hau is 30 years old. She has two children whom are studying in primary school. She raises pig and be a worker. From her job, she gains 3,800,000 VND a month. She has taken part in crediting program of SEDA from 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to enlarge her pigsty.

loans.use: to enlarge her pigsty.

loans.name: Thi's Group

texts.en:
Thi is 35 years old. She has two children whom are studying in primary school. She raises pig and be a worker. From her job, she gains 3,900,000 VND a month. She has taken part in crediting program of SEDA from 2011. The last cycle, she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 6,944,000 VND to enlarge her pigsty.
 Lieu is 32 years old. She wants to borrow 6,944,000 VND to open a small beverage stall.

loans.use: to enlarge her pigsty.

loans.name: Giang

texts.en: Giang is 41 years old. She has two children whom one is in high school and one is adult. She raises pigs and sells cooked food for a living. She has done these job for 11 years and gained from them 4,200,000 VND. She has taken part in crediting program of SEDA from 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to upgrade her pigsty.

loans.use: to upgrade her pigsty.

loans.name: Chut

texts.en: Chut is 53 years old. She has three children whom are all adult. She raises doves and sells sausage in the market for a living. She has done these job for 13 years and gained from them 4,300,000 VND. She has taken part in crediting program of SEDA from 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to upgrade and enlarge her dove cages.

loans.use: to upgrade and enlarge her dove cages.

loans.name: Burungu Tukwatanize Group

texts.en:
Sylivia is a 31-year-old woman with three children living in Fort Portal,Uganda. She has a personal goal of educating her children and upgrading her studies.

Sylivia has been farming for the last 2 years and used her personal savings to buy land. She faces hardships of seasonal weather and inadequate capital to meet the high demand. She has a vision of expanding her farming activities to new areas and venturing into mechanized agriculture.

Sylivia needs a loan to buy agricultural inputs such as seedlings and fertilizers. She is a member of the above mentioned group, where each member guarantees the others in accessing a loan.Out of the sixteen members only ten took the only and the rest had to appear in the photo as per the group policy.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a petty trader. She sells vegetables such as garden eggs (mock tomatoes or huckleberries), peppers, tomatoes, onions and other food items at Aboadzi, near Elmina. 

Grace has been in this business for some time now and she wishes to buy other food items which her customers have requested. Because of this demand, a loan from Kiva will be used to buy a variety of vegetables to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Revendeuse d’habits de façon ambulante, Madame Adjo est mère de 02 enfants âgés de 12 et 07ans qui sont tous sur les bancs de l’école. Elle a commencé par faire cette activité il y a 08ans pour prêter main forte à son conjoint électricien bâtiment dans les charges du ménage. Elle sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour s’approvisionner en marchandises (robes et collants). Elle veut épargner le profit, agrandir l’activité et permettre à ses enfants de mieux scolariser.
texts.en:
Adjo works as a street seller, selling clothing. She has two children aged twelve and seven, both of whom are at school. She started her business eight years ago to help her husband, a building electrician, with the household expenses. 

Adjo has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy merchandise (dresses and panty hose). She wants to save her profits, expand her business, and give her children a better education.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Tanamory Salikegne Group

texts.fr:
Mise en place le 14 Décembre 2010, ce banc villageois est composé de femmes d’une motivation exemplaire à faire face aux difficultés de leur milieu. Elles pratiquent en majorité la restauration et le petit commerce car se trouvant dans une zone frontalière fréquentés par beaucoup de voyageurs.

  Madame Awa,(assise à droite  restauratrice depuis plus d’une quinzaine d’années est veuve, âgée de 55 ans  et mère de trois enfants dont une fille. Avec l’aide une bonne elle prépare des repas qu’elle vend aux différents voyageurs  en partance pour la sous région.

Avec ce nouveau prêt elle compte acheter 03 sacs de riz à 14 500 FCFA le sac, un bidon d’huile de 20 litre et assaisonnement.

Les bénéfices qu’elle tire de cette activité lui permettront de prendre en charge les frais scolaires de ses enfants inscris à l’école privée.
texts.en:
This banc villageois, founded on December 14, 2010, comprises women whose motivation to cope with social difficulties is exemplary.

Since they live in a border area visited by many travelers, most of these women are involved in the preparation of meals or in small retail business.

Awa (sitting on the right-hand side) has been preparing meals for over fifteen years.  At age 55, she is a widow and the mother of three children, one of whom is a girl.

With a maid's help, she prepares meals which she sells to travelers going to the sub-region.

With this new loan, she is planning to buy three bags of rice costing 14,500 CFA francs each, one 20-liter container of oil and some seasoning.

The profits from this activity help her to pay for her children's private school tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of rice costing 14,500 CFA francs each, one 20-liter container of oil and some seasoning.

loans.name: Thiarra's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été crée le 28 Décembre 2011. ils sont des membres habitant la même localité et exerçant ensemble la même activité qu'est le petit commerce. 

Debout à droite de la photo, la responsable est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont 02 garçons et 04 filles. Son activité principale est le commerce de tissus brodés. 

Avec le prêt reçu elle va acheter des pièces de tissu et des fils de couleurs différentes pour la confection et elle revend le fini au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires.

Avec les bénéfices générés, elle renforce ses épargnes, paie ses intérêts et améliore les conditions de vie de sa progéniture.
texts.en:
The Sopp Mohamed Gawane group was created December 28, 2011. It is made up of members living in the same area and all running small businesses.

Standing up at the right of the photo is the group leader, a married women and mother of 6 children, 2 boys and 4 girls. Her main business is the sale of embroidered fabrics.

With the loan she receives, she is going to buy pieces of fabric and thread in different colors for sewing and she will sell the finished product at the weekly markets.

With the general profits, she will reinforce her savings, pay her interest and improve her children's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pieces of fabric and thread in different colors to sew and resell.

loans.name: Daba's Group

texts.fr:
Le bv de Diomkhel a été crée le 04 Juin 2011. Le groupe est composé de membres ayant des cohésions sociales. 

Debout à droite de la photo, la responsable est âgée de 28 ans. 

Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont 02 filles et 01 garçon. 

Avec le prêt reçu elle va acheter des cochons de lait, les engraisser pendant un certain temps avant de les revendre. 

Avec les bénéfices générés par son activité, elle va construire sa maison, renforcer ses épargnes pour préparer l'avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The Diomkhel B.V. was founded June 4, 2011. The group is made up of members with social ties.

Standing up at the right of the photo, the leader is 28 years old.

She is married and mother of three children, two girls and a boy.

With the loan, she will buy suckling pigs and fatten them for a period of time before reselling them.

With the profits generated through this business, she is going to build her house and reinforce her savings to prepare for her children's future.

loans.use: to buy suckling pigs and raise them to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La Sra. Patricia tiene un hijo que se va ha graduarse y quiere que su hijo lo disfrute y para ello necesita cubrir  los gastos como fotografías, vestuario,  pago de la entrega de papelería y con esto se sentirá bien por que su hijo tendrá una recompensa por su esfuerzo.
La Sra. Patricia vive con su esposo quien la apoya en todo momento, su esposo trabaja como chofer de carretera para una empresa de la localidad, los dos han acordado que su mayor deseo es que sus hijos reciban una buena educción y mismo garantisandoles  un futuro mejor  lleno de oportunidades 
generadas en base de ese estudio que la señora patricia y su esposo con tanto esfuerzo
y sacrificio le brindan a sus hijos
brindandoles un amejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Patricia has a son who is going to graduate.  She wants her son to enjoy it, so she needs to cover the expenses for photography, clothing, and the fees for the graduation papers.  With this she will feel good because her son will be rewarded for his effort.

Patricia lives with her husband, who always supports her.  He works as a truck driver for a local business.  The two have agreed that their biggest desire is for their children to have a good education.  This will guarantee them a better future filled with opportunities based on those studies that Patricia and her husband give their children with so much effort, offering them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for her son's graduation expenses.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de duas filha que frequenta a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais uma neta que vive com ela. 	
É negociante e dona do negócio de venda de produtos diversos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (arroz, sumos, massa, óleo, capulanas e sapatos) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja concluir da sua casa e mobilar para oferecer conforto a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a instabilidade do negócio e o elevado custo de vida.
texts.en: Paulina is a window the mother of two daughters who go to school.  She lives in her own home with her family and also supports a granddaughter that lives with her.  She has her own business selling various products.  With her current loan, she will buy products (rice, juice, dough, butter, capulanas [a garment worn in Mozambique], and shoes) to increase her quantity of merchandise.  In the future, she hopes to finish her home and to furnish it to offer comfort to her family.  To do this, she promises to make her payments on time so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.  Her challenge is the instability of her business and the elevated cost of living.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (rice, juice, dough, butter, capulanas, and shoes).

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 46 years old, married and has six children. She sells cakes, doughnuts and bread to earn a living. She has engaged in the business for two years and has employed two people. She also does farming for extra income. Previously, she owned a van for a transport business. 

Rebecca hopes to open another outlet of his business in the future. She needs a loan of 65,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy an oven.

loans.use: to buy an oven

loans.name: Angellina

texts.en: Angellina is 52 years old and widowed with two children, ages 21 and 25. She runs a cafeteria to earn a living. She has been in the business since 2008.  She has employed one person in the business. She also does poultry farming for more income generation. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save her money because she has been trained in financial management. Angellina has requested for 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Abir from Aberdeen western area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of eight and eighteen, who are currently attending school. In 2009, Abir established her general merchandise business. She began her business because she wanted to generate income to support her family. She works at the business every day except holidays. At present, she faces high transportation costs to move her goods from town to her store.
Abir requires a loan in order to buy more provisions such as eggs, milk, rice, and sugar. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, Abir plans to expand her business further. She thanks you for your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Abir from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy more provisions, such as eggs, milk, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia, from Sulipat, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, is 46 years old, married, and has 4 children. To make a living, Letecia plants, harvests, and sells vegetables. In business for 15 years, she earns 6,000 PHP per month. In 2008, Letecia joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Letecia plans to use the extra revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Deborah Crop Photo Make It Half To See Clients Eye

texts.en:
Janet is 30 years old and is married with two children. She operates a M-pesa business (a mobile-phone based money transfer service). She has been in this business for 2 years earning a monthly income of 130,000 shillings.

This will be Janet's first loan with Kadet and she plans to use it for adding more float. She plans to use the anticipated profit to cater to her family's needs. She hopes to have enough float to serve more clients and also to open another M-pesa shop in the future.

loans.use: This will be her first loan with Kadet and plans to use it for adding more float

borrowers.first_name: Deborah Crop Photo Make It Half To See Clients Eye

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 55 years old and has five children who are in school. He is hardworking and does livestock farming to earn a living. He has engaged himself in this business for two years and has employed one person. 

Through Faulu Kenya, he knows the importance of saving because he has been trained in financial management. He dreams of opening a butcher shop to sell goat meat in the future. He needs a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more goats and sheep.

loans.use: To buy more goats and sheep.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace used to sell waakye (beans and rice mixed together), but she recently opened a cosmetics store at Dompoase, near Elmina. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. She is responsible for paying her children’s school fees, and her husband pays for other household expenses. Her loan will be used to expand her store. Grace hopes to use the new profits to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her store.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a widower aged 43; he has two children. He applied for a loan of eight million shillings to buy cows to trade. He has been in this business for the last ten years and has vast experience in this and because of this very business he has been able to educate his siblings as well as children.

Apart from cattle keeping and trade, Wilson is also engaged in various economic activities like trading in milk and goats which supplement his income. However, Wilson faces some challenges: lack of enough capital being the biggest contributor followed by vagaries of weather and price fluctuations.

loans.use: To buy cows.

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is 44 years old.  She is a widow and lives in a small village of the Dusheti District with her family, which is comprised of her son, Vladimer, her daughter-in-law and her mother-in-law, who is a pensioner.  

Vladimer works in construction and receives a service fee for the work he completes.  Mzia is busy with farming.  She has a plot of land where she grows maize and tomatoes.  She works hard on her plot to ensure a good harvest and sells the harvested products on the local open market.  In addition, to her agricultural business, Mzia and her daughter-in-law are busy with trading.  They sell secondhand clothes in nearby villages.  The family’s total average monthly income is 900 Lari.

Mzia has requested a loan to start a new business.  She plans to open beer bar.  With the loan, she will purchase the necessary equipment for the bar, mainly furniture and refrigerator.  She thinks that a lot of beer will be sold in the hot summer months, enabling the family to earn additional income.  With the increased income, Mzia will be able to invest in the family agricultural business, expanding it and making it more profitable.  As a result, the family’s living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to purchase all the necessary equipment for a beer bar.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is divorced and has two children. She sells cloth and bags near Kwarhinkrom, which she has done for five years. She uses her income to feed and clothe her children, as well as pay their school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more cloth and bags. She hopes to use the new profits to continue to expand her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy more cloth and bags.

loans.name: Sister Aba

texts.en: Sister Aba is married and has five children. Her husband is an electrician. Aba sells banku and waakye near Kwarhinkrom, which she has done for three years. Banku is cooked and fermented cassava or maize dough and waakye is beans and rice mixed together. Aba uses her income to pay for her children’s school fees. Aba will use the loan to purchase to buy more maize, rice, etc. With the new profits, Aba plans to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more maize, rice, etc.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 34 years old, married and has two children. 

Iman is a seamstress and she is been in this field since 1998. She makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally including suits, coats and trousers for women and kids. She has a deep understanding of local customers and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is well known in the surrounding areas.

She is requesting a $2400 loan to purchase two sewing machines and fabrics. She is aiming to increase her production and gain more profit. This will offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase two sewing machines and fabrics

loans.name: Amie

texts.en: Amie 39, is married  with  five  children. She has been working hard  to meet with her family's  needs, and for  the past sixteen years, she has been selling donuts in her community. Her children are currently in school and are between the ages  of 8  to  22  years. They  all live at Gardnersville. She  likes to do  this kind of business  because  she  make a profit  every day. She uses the profit to improve the business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more  flour, sugar,  and cooking oil to prepare  more donuts. Her  plans   are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more  flour, sugar,  and cooking oil to prepare  more donuts.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson is a 40-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been buying and selling bananas for seven years. His hardships are price fluctuation and inflation. His personal goal is educating his children and his business goal is moving his business to a more permanent location. Johnson wants the loan to buy bananas to sell.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his banana plantation.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is married and has one child. Her husband is a sanitary worker.  Efua sells kenkey and fish near Kwarhinkrom, which she has done for 40 years. Efua uses her income to pay her daughter’s school fees. Efua will use the loan to purchase fish and maize in bulk. With the new profits, Efua plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish and maize in bulk.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 26 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. She sells cosmetics to earn a living. In the same business she also sells clothes. She has been in the business for two years and has employed one person. She also does pig farming to generate extra income. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save because she has been trained on financial management. She dreams of expanding her business and becoming successful in the future. She needs a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy cosmetics and clothes.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Anah

texts.en: Anah is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 6 to 18. She describes herself to be a jovial and faithful woman. She operates a retail store where she sells cereals such as maize, peas, beans etc. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located at a busy area and her primary customers are local households. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor impassible roads leading to high prices of transportation to her business premise. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to buy more cereals. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more cereals for resale.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Madame Diodio est une femme marié âgé de 38 ans et mère de 6 enfants .Diodio est membre du banc villageois depuis le 26/12/2011. Elle est lié avec ses camarades par de bonnes relations sociales et économiques.
Elle s'active dans le petit commerce depuis longtemps. Diodio est debout à droite de la photo la main levée habillée en grand boubou vert olive.
Son nouveau crédit de 75000 francs lui permettra de se procurer des paniers de poissons au niveau de la plage et de les revendre au détails dans son quartier.
les bénéfices réalisés par son activité lui permettent de prendre en charges certaines charges familiales telles que la scolarité et l 'alimentation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Madame Diodio is a 38 year old married woman and mother of six children. Diodio has been a member of the village lending group since 12/26/2011. She is linked with the other members by good social and financial relations.
She has been active in small business for a long time. Diodio is standing up at the right of the photo with her hand raised in the long olive green tunic.
Her new loan of 75,000 francs will allow her to buy baskets of fish at the beach and resell them individually in her area.
The profits generated by this business will allow her to take care of various expenses of her family, such as the education and nourishment of her children.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es: Cruz de 66 años de edad es casado, sus hijos son mayores y trabajan, pequeño agricultor con mas de 56 años de experiencia, pues desde que era niño se ha dedicado a la agricultura,su esposa tambien trabaja junto a el apoyando en las labores del campo, solicita su primer credito con el objetivo de sembrar maiz, pero necesita comprar herbicidas para preparar la tierra y que la cosecha sea excelente y poder obtener buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Cruz, 66 years old, is married. His children are working adults. He is a small farmer will over 56 years of experience. He has worked in agriculture since he was a child. His wife also works with him, assisting by working in the fields. He is requesting his first loan so he can plant corn, but he needs to buy herbicides to prepare the land so he has an abundant harvest and can earn a good profit.

loans.use: to plant corn

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom, 34, is married with five children living at home in the Takeo province. She grows vegetables, typically making US$2 each day and her husband makes and sells palm sugar. Her husband, Bou Son, typically makes about US$4 each day.Both of them are in the picture above.Mom would like a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorbike to transport palm sugar to sell at the local market.

loans.use: purchase a motorbike to transport palm sugar to sell at the local market

loans.name: Keanan

texts.en: Keanan, 28, is married and lives with her husband and two young children in the Kampong Chhnang province. Selling wood with her husband, she makes US$6 each day.Keanan is asking for a loan of US$700 to purchase a motorbike to transport wood. She sees this purchase a good investment to expand her business and she is confident it will increase her income.

loans.use: purchase a motorbike to transport wood

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en: Phalla, 45, lives in the Kampong Chhnang province with her husband and five children. She works as a farmer, making US$1 a day, and is supported by her husband who is a moto-taxi driver, making US$10 a day.  In light of these times of economic difficulties,Phalla is asking for a loan of US$800 to build a latrine and purchase fertilizer to put on her farm.

loans.use: to build a latrine and purchase fertilizer to put on her farm

loans.name: Thart

texts.en: Thart, 52, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Chhnang province. Since 1999, she has been selling duck eggs, making around US$17 in income each day. Her husband works in construction, typically make US$3 each day as well.Thart is asking for a loan of US$500 to reinvest in her duck eggs business. She believes that this loan can raise her standard of living and provide valuable resources for her family.

loans.use: reinvest in her duck eggs business

loans.name: Vanleng

texts.en: Vanleng, 47, is a widow with three children living at home in the Kampong Chhnang province. She and her oldest son working together making and selling rice noodle in the local market, typically making US$10 in income each day.Vanleng would like a loan of US$800 to purchase wood to finish her construction.

loans.use: purchase wood to finish her construction.

loans.name: Vicheka

texts.en: Vicheka, 26, is married and lives with her one young child in the Kampong Chhnang province. She and her husband work in a garment factory, making a combine of US$7 each day. This couple is asking for a loan of US$800 to purchase wood and construction material to finish their construction.

loans.use: purchase wood and construction material to finish their construction

loans.name: Somroeun

texts.en: Somroeun is 58 years old, married and lives with her one son in kampong Chhnang Province. She and her son makes traditional basket for sale in her house, earning about USD 1.5 per day. Somroeun is requesting a loan of USD 500 to buy a motor to transport her product to the market. In the future, she hopes she can build more part in her house like build a new wall and buy more products to resale.

loans.use: buy a motor to transport her product to the market

loans.name: Lav

texts.en: Lav is 29 years old. She is married and resides with 2 children In Kampona chhnang Province, Cambodia. Lav is a farmer and making stone pan, earning income USD 4. Her husband is construction worker and motor taxi, earning income around USD4. Each month, she has to spend on food USD 30, on utility expense USD 10 and other expenses USD30. Lav is requesting a loan of USD450 to buy new motorbike for her husband go to work and run motor taxi service. This loan will help her husband go to work easily and get more profit when he provide motor taxi. In the future, she hopes she can build a new house and buy more animal to feed and resale.

loans.use: buy new motorbike for her husband go to work and run motor taxi service

loans.name: Sokroeurn

texts.en: is 43 years old, married and resides with her three children in Kampong Chhnang Province. She buys and sells sugar, earning income about USD4 per day. Her husband is security guard and also motor taxi driver, earning income about USD6 per day. One of her children is a guard in garment factory, earning income around USD2.6 per day. Sokroeurn is requesting a loan of USD 1500 to buy equipment to build her house. In the future, she hopes she can support her children get high education.

loans.use: buy equipment to build her house

loans.name: Chantho

texts.en: Chantho is 31 years old, married and resides with one children in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a farmer, earning income around USD4 per day. Her husband is worker in garment factory, earning profit above USD 4 per day. Chantho is requesting a loan of USD 600 to buy farm land for doing her farming. This loan will help her family get more profit with good living standard.

loans.use: buy farm land for doing her farming

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao is 52 years old, married and reside with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province. she is a traditional doctor, earning income about USD2.5. Her husband is cattle seller, earning around USD 5 per day. Mao is requesting a loan of USD 300 to buy motorbike go to work.

loans.use: buy motorbike go to work

loans.name: Chanmony

texts.en: Chanmony is 32 years old, married and resides with 2 children in Kampong Chhnang Province. she sells grocery, earning income USD 25 per day. Her husband buys and sells chili, earning income about USD 20 per day. Chanmony is requesting a loan of USD 1500 to buy Tok Tok to transport for getting more fee. she hopes this loan will help her to get more profit and live in good living standard.

loans.use: buy Tok Tok to transport for getting more fee

loans.name: Rosellia

texts.en:
Rosellia has been blessed with seven children.   She is a food vendor at their place in Sicayab, Dipolog City and has been in business for five years.  She needs additional capital for her business in the amount of 14,000 PHP in order to purchase stock for her daily business.

Rosellia is a new member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has been active for almost one year and four months.  In the future, she hopes that her business will be successful so that she can sustain their daily needs.  She is thankful to Paglaum for allowing her to borrow money for additional capital.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for food production.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 59 years old and lives in Rizal, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children.

Lorna has a general store that sells a variety of products including soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies, and many other items.  She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of 14,900 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase more stock for her general store.

Lorna has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. She hopes to have a brighter future ahead.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Aissatou est une femme veuve âgée de 54 ans et aucun enfant à sa charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis sa fondation et fait parti du groupe de solidarité Fass Diom. 
Elle s'active dans le petit commerce et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine et partage de bonnes relations sociales et économiques avec les membres de son groupement en général et ceux de son groupe de solidarité en particulier.
Son nouveau crédit de 225000 lui permettra de payer de la marchandise pré citée pour les revendre au détail dans son quartier.
Les bénéfice que génèrent son activité lui permettent d'agrandir son activité mais également  de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
Aissatou is a 54 year old widow with no children in her care. She has been a member of the village lending group since its founding and is part of the solidarity group Fass Diom.
She practices small business and has a good experience in this area. She has good social and financial relations with the members of her grouping in general and those of her solidarity group in particular.
Her new loan of 225,000 francs will allow her to pay for the aforementioned merchandise to resell retail in her area.
The profits that her business generates will allow her to grow her business but also to strengthen her savings at the level of the village lending group.

loans.use: to buy groundnut paste, fabric, and tobacco.

loans.name: Ndeye Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou est une femme mariée âgée 58 ans et mère de 5 enfants dont 2 filles et 3 garçons.Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis sa fondation le 28/12/2010 et y est unis par des femmes du même quartier qui pratiquent toutes le petit commerce. Fatou fait du petit commerce par la vente de chaussures et d’encens elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine. Elle debout à droite de la photo la main levée habillé en tissu jaune .
Son nouveau crédit de125000 franc lui permettra de se procurer de la marchandises de l’encens qu'elle va revendre au détail au niveau du quartier et à ses camarades du banc villageois. 
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettront de renforcer son capital et de se payer de la marchandise et d'aider sa famille dans la gestion alimentaire quotidienne.
texts.en:
Madame Fatou is a 58 year old married woman and mother of five children, two girls and three boys. She has been a member of the village lending group since its founding on 12/28/2010 and is united there with women from the same area who all work in small business. Fatou has a small business, selling shoes and incense, and has good experience in this area. She is standing up at the right of the photo wearing yellow, with her hand raised. Her new loan of 125,000 francs will allow her to buy incense that she is going to resell retail in her area and to the other members of the village lending group.
The profits that she makes will allow her to strengthen her capital, to pay for merchandise, and to help her with her family's everyday food purchases.

loans.use: to buy shoes and incense.

loans.name: Thiembou's Group

texts.fr:
Madame khardiata est une femme mariée âgée de 41 ans et mère de trois enfants dont deux filles et un garçon. Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis son inauguration et partagent de bonnes relations avec les femmes de son groupe qui habitent le même quartier. Khardiata s'active dans le commerce depuis longtemps et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.
Elle est  debout à gauche de la photo la main levée et habillé en boubou orange. Son nouveau crédit de 85000 lui permet de se procurer du poissons fumés qu'elle va revendre au détails au niveau de son quartier.
les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires et scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Madame Khardiata is a 41 year old married woman who is mother to three children including two girls and one boy. She has been a member of the "banc villageois" since its inauguration and she has good relations with the women in her group who live in the same neighborhood. Khardiata has been working as a trader for a long time and has good experience in this field.
She is standing on the left of the photo wearing an orange robe with her hand raised. This new loan of 85,000 will enable her to buy smoked fish that she will sell retail in her neighborhood.
She will use the profits of her business to take care of feeding and educating her children.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa sells onions and other types of vegetables at jukwa market near Abura. 

She is married and blessed with six dependents. As part of her responsibilities, she supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. 

The loan will be used to obtain bags of onions to meet the demands of her customers. Any increase that may come as a result of the loan will be ploughed back into the business.

loans.use: to obtain bags of onions to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Ramatulai

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32-year-old Ramatulai from Waterloo, eastern area in Freetown. She is married with four children between the ages of two years old and seventeen. Two of her children attend school. 

Ramatulai runs a general merchandise store in a busy market area. She sells cigarettes, Ovaltine, milk and sugar. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business every day expect holidays. Her business is the only source of income she has. She describes her biggest challenge as high incidence of theft in Waterloo.

Ramatulai has requested a loan in order to buy more cigarettes, Ovaltine, sugar, books and pens, as it is now school holidays. Parents would buy these things for their children when school reopens. The extra income from this loan will allow Ramatulai to educate her children and expand her business In the future; she plans to become an international businesswoman. She thanks you for your support!

video.title: Kiva Borrower Sheriff from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy more cigarettes, Ovaltine, sugar, books and pens

loans.name: Santa Devora

texts.es: Santa tiene 32 años y tiene un gabinete de belleza en su domicilio. Ella empezó el negocio atendiendo clientes a domicilio ya que siempre le gusto el arte de la belleza, hizo esto por varios años con esfuerzo y dedicación hasta que su perseverancia dio frutos. Ahora ella tiene un gabinete de belleza bien equipado en el que realiza cortes con estilo para hombres y mujeres, tinturados, alisados con queratina, peinados para eventos, y maquillaje. Realiza el trabajo sola ya que a sus clientes le gusta su trato y prefieren esperar a ser atendidos por otra persona, como obsevamos en la foto en la cual hay 3 personas esperano ser atendidad por turnos de llegada, Santa esta vestida con blusa blanca y falda atras de su clienta la cual es esta sentada lista para empezar con el corte de cabello. Es por esto por lo que trabaja de 8 de la mañana a 6 de la tarde. Su mayor preocupación es los robos pero es normal es todas partes y de momento no le ha pasado nada, tal vez su suerte se deba a que su esposo es policía. Con el crédito que está solicitando, ella comprara tintes, cremas de alisado, maquillaje, esmaltes, toallas, sillones y un espejo para mejorar la impresión de su local. Su mayor sueño es abrir otro local del negocio así seguiría apoyando a su esposo y juntos tendrían un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Santa, 32, has a beauty salon at home.  She started this business providing beauty services in her customers’ homes because she’s always liked the art of beauty.  She did this for several years and with effort and dedication her perseverance paid off.  

Now, she has her well-equipped beauty salon where she provides haircuts for men and women, hair coloring, hair straightening using keratin, hair styling for special events and makeup.  She does all the work by herself since her customers like the way she treats them and prefer to wait rather than have someone else provide the service.  Because of this, she works from 8am until 6pm.  Her greatest concern is robberies but that’s common everywhere and to date nothing’s happened to her.  Perhaps her good luck is due to the fact that her husband is a police officer.

She will use the requested loan to buy hair color, straightening creams, makeup, nail polish, towels, chairs and a mirror to improve her locale’s appearance.  Her greatest dream is to open another locale for her business to continue helping her husband so that together they will have a better future.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon supplies.

loans.name: Omuhereza

texts.en: Omuhereza is a 51-year-old married woman with three children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She owns a produce store and has been operating it for 21 years now. She started with a retail shop and later ventured into a wholesale produce store. She lacks enough capital to purchase in bulk all the necessary grains for milling and her desire is to have two stores. Omuhereza intends to use the loan facility to buy rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El cliente Juan Carlos, es un señor de 22 años de edad, es casado con la señora Benedicta, el cliente presta sus servicios como chofer de una empresa de productos lácteos en una provincia que se encuentra a 15 horas de viaje de la ciudad de Cochabamba, que se encuentra al oeste de la ciudad,  actualmente el cliente vive por la zona oeste de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la casa donde vive el cliente es propia y de su familia, el cliente vive con su esposa y sus hermanos, y el destino del nuevo crédito es para capital de comercio ya que su esposa del cliente se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos en el mercado local de la ciudad, y el capital es para aumentar su negocio como también su mercadería y así mejorar sus ingresos para la sostenibilidad de su familia, es por lo cual reflejamos esta pequeña historia del cliente, para el conocimiento de todos ustedes.
texts.en:
The client, Juan Carlos is a 22 year old man. He is married to Benedicta. He lends his services as a driver for a dairy product business in a province that is found 15 hours from the city of Cochabamba toward the west. He currently lives in the western zone of Cochabamba. The house in which he lives is his own and of his family. He lives with his wife and siblings. 

The purpose of the new from the institution is for trading capital because his wife makes a living in the sale of dairy products in the city's local market. The capital is to expand his business and his merchandise. As such, he will improve his earnings for his family's livelihood. For this reason the client's history is reflected upon--for your own knowledge.

loans.use: compra de insumos y capital de comercio para la venta de leche.

loans.name: Mercedes Alina

texts.es: La Sra. Alina tiene 47 años y vive en la comunidad de Guerra del Departamento. de Tarija,   la Sra.
