Alina es casada; tiene y vive en casa propia junto a su hijo, por lo que su esposo viaja a otro pais a trabajar por lo que no participa en el presente crédito, tiene principalmente la producción de productos agrícolas, esta producción la realiza en terrenos propios de herencia de su padre cuenta con herramientas y terrenos necesarios para esta actividad, al Sra., Alina nos indica que con el crédito que sacara lo usara para la compra de semilla de papa como también para compra de abono orgánico para la producción de papa que sacara el mes de octubre, según la experiencia que tiene en este negocio nos indica que sus ventas se irán incrementando a medida que se vayan mejorando el proceso productivo.
texts.en:
Alina is 47 years old and lives in the Guerra del Departamento community of Tarija. Alina is married and lives in her own house with her son. Her husband traveled to another country for work and as such, is not participating in the current loan. She primarily works in the production of agricultural products. She does this work on her own land inherited from her father. She has her own tools and land necessary for this work. 

Alina has said that with the loan that she is taking out she will buy potato seeds as well as organic fertilizer for the potato production which will take up the month of October. According to the experience she has in this work, she says that her sales will continue increasing at a measure that will improve the production process.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds.

loans.name: Nader

texts.en:
Nader, who appears in the picture, is a 30-year-old young man. He is married and a father to one daughter. He is employed but gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

Nader is requesting a loan of 3,000 US dollars (USD) from FATEN to help him cover the costs of building a wall around his house. This will provide privacy to Nader and his family from surrounding neighbors and enable them to live in better and comfortable home conditions.

loans.use: to cover the cost of building a wall around his house.

loans.name: Boeurn

texts.en: Boeurn is 36 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $5 each day. One of her children is a construction worker as well. He earns about $4 daily. Boeurn is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a pumping machine to pump the water into her rice field. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn higher education. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a pumping machine to pump the water into her rice field

loans.name: Sam Oeurn

texts.en: Sam Oeurn is 44 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing agricultural crops for more than twenty years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $3 each day. Three of her children are garment workers who earn about $9 each day. In order to improve her farming business, Sam Oeurn is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase a walking tractor to use for tilling her farmland. In the future, she would like to run an additional business of animal husbandry to generate more income to support the family and help her youngest child earn bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a walking tractor to use for tilling her farmland

loans.name: Chan Ly

texts.en: Chan Ly is 44 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating lotus to sell for more than two years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $3 daily. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Chan Ly is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase lotus seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to use for cultivating. This money will her expand her business and earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to rent more land for growing lotus and help her children earn bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a bathroom for her family.

loans.use: to purchase lotus seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for cultivating

loans.name: Doeurn

texts.en: Doeurn is 58 years old. He is married and resides with two children in Battambang Province, Cambodia. He is a motor taxi driver who earns about $7 per day. One of her children is employed in a restaurant and earns about $3 daily. Because of the present motorbike is old, Doeurn is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a new motorbike for his motor taxi service. In the future, she would like to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for his taxi service

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en: Moreen is 31 years old and lives in Hoima, Uganda. She has been operating a yogurt business for the past five years. She started as a farmer, and after saving enough money, she ventured into her current business. She used the previous loan to purchase a processing machine and now her business is operating efficiently. She has a challenge of her customers not paying on time and her business goal is to expand to new markets. Moreen intends to use the loan to purchase a yogurt for sell.

loans.use: to buy a yogurt packing machine.

loans.name: Dy

texts.en: Dy is 50 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Battambang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than four years, earning approximately $20 daily. Her husband helps her run the business. In order to improve her family’s finances, Dy is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase fruits to resell. This money will help her run an additional business and generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her child earn bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase fruits to resell

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Sokha is 56 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing agricultural crops for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband is a commune council who earns about $4 each day. Two of her children are employed in super market and earns about $7 each day. Sokha is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase dirt to fill up her farmland. In the future, she would like to purchase more farmland to expand her business and help her child earn bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase dirt to fill up her farmland

loans.name: Heak

texts.en:
Heak is 38 years old. He is married and lives with one child in Battambang Province, Cambodia. 

He has been running a business of buying motorcycles to resell for more than two years, earning approximately $4 a day. His wife sells sausages and earns about $8 a day. 

In order to improve his business, Heak is requesting a loan of $1,200 to raise capital in his business to purchase more motorcycles to resell. By doing so, he would be able to make more profit to support the family. In the future, he would like to run a motorcycle shop and send his child to a good school. Moreover, he hopes to rebuild his house to make it more convenient for his family.

loans.use: to raise capital in his business to purchase more motorcycles to resell.

loans.name: Auntie

texts.en: Auntie operates a provisions store and also sells clothing in Adum Banso, near Takoradi. She has been in this business for the past eight years. Auntie is married and has five children. Her husband is a contractor at the local palm oil plantation. Auntie is responsible for paying her children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more goods for her store. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods for her store.

loans.name: Winefred

texts.en: Winefred sells minerals in Adum Banso, near Takoradi. Winefred has completed junior high school.  She is divorced and has two children. Winefred has been selling minerals for four years now. She is responsible for paying her children’s school fees as well as all other household expenses such as utility bills and feeding/clothing her children. Her loan will be used to buy different kinds of drinks. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of drinks

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 25-year-old single woman. She has a daughter who is 2 years old. She describes herself to be a focused woman. 

Grace operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services such as plaiting, blowdrying, etc. She has been involved in this business for 3 years and employs 1 staff members. Her business is located within a strategic business environment  and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. 

Grace will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more beauty products for use in her salon. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will have expanded her business and created more job opportunities.

loans.use: buy products for her salon

loans.name: Srey Nal

texts.en: Srey Nal is 30 years old. She is married and blesses with one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries and meat ball for more than ten years, earning approximately $6 per day. Her husband runs the taxi service. He earns about $3 daily. In order to improve her family’s finances, Srey Nal is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more groceries to resell. By doing so, she would be able to make more profit to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her store and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell

loans.name: Sok Cheng

texts.en:
Sok Cheng is 30 years old.  She is married, blessed with one child and lives in Kandal Province, Cambodia.  She has been growing mangoes for more than four years, earning approximately $4 per day.   Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $4 per day.   

Sok Cheng is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and seeds for cultivating mangoes.  In the future, she would like to purchase more farmland and send her child to a good school.  Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and seeds to grow mangoes

loans.name: Jo-Anne

texts.en: A 41-year-old woman named Jo-anne is a newly recognized member of PMPC.  She is married and has two children who are 16 and 12 years old. She has been engaged in selling ready to wear clothes for three years to help her husband support the family.  She took a loan from PMPC intended for additional capital to acquire more stocks for sale to increase her household income.  She hopes that this is a means of uplifting the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: additional capital for buy and sell ready to wear business

loans.name: Tasla

texts.fr: Madame Tasla est une femme mariée âgée de 53 ans et mère de huit enfants et deux qui lui sont confiés.Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis sa création et fait partie du groupe de solidarité Takku Liggey.Elle est unie avec ses camarades par des liens sociaux.Tasla s'active dans le commerce de produits divers depuis longtemps et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.Avec son nouveau crédit de 400000 lui permettra de se procurer de la marchandise qu'elle va revendre au niveau de son quartier.Les bénéfices lui permettent de gérer ses besoins personnels et entretenir sa maison qu'elle à mis en location.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tasla, age 53, is married and the mother of eight children. She also has two other children entrusted to her care. She's been a member of the "banc villageois" since its establishment  and is part of Takku Liggey Group. She's linked to the other members by social bonds.

For a long time, Tasla's business has been to buy and sell various products, and she has a good experience in this field. With her new XOF 400'000 loan, she will be able to buy supplies to resell in her neighborhood.

Her profits enable her to provide for her own needs and maintain her house, which she rents out.

loans.use: to buy various products to resell

loans.name: Saralyn

texts.en:
Saralyn is married and has 4 children.  She is 38 years old and resides in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Saralyn owns and operates a farm, planting  and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living.  She's been 5 years in this business. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of business.  This year, Saralyn joined GDMPC. 

Saralyn requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to pay labor costs for land plowing. She wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: pay labor costs for land plowing

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children. He is a 30-year-old married man living in a company house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is an employee of a tea company, where he works as an electrician, and he is the only breadwinner for his family. His challenge is price fluctuations and inflation. His dream is to educate his children and complete building his own house. Godfrey needs a loan to buy iron sheets for his residential house.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets.

loans.name: Mareth

texts.en:
Mareth is 36 years old. She is widowed and blessed with three children in Kratie Province, Cambodia. She has been selling Khmer cake (cake made of sticky rice and wrapped with bamboo leaves) for more than ten years, earning approximately $20 daily.

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Mareth is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelors degrees. Moreover, she hopes to fill up the dirt on the land adjacent to her house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Savy is 42 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kratie Province, Cambodia. She has been working as a teacher for more than twenty years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband sells soy milk. He earns about $25 each day.

Savy is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase timber to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living condition for her family. In future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase timber to build a new house

loans.name: Keum Srait

texts.en:
Keum Srait is 31 years old. She is married and resides with a daughter in Kratie Province, Cambodia. She has been selling clothes for more than two years, earning approximately $10 per day. Her husband (who joined her in the picture) sells water around his village. He earns about $9 each day.

In order to improve her family’s finances, Keum Srait is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more fashionable clothes to resell. By doing so, she will be able to make more profit to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her daughter to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more fashionable clothes to resell

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is 71 years old. She is widowed and resides with two children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing agricultural crops for more than twenty years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her daughter is a garment worker who earns about $3 each day.

In order to improve her family’s finances, Sok is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase vegetables and butcher to resell at the market. By doing so, she would earn additional income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run hair salon for her daughter and build fence around her house.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and butcher to resell in at the market

loans.name: Amulasi

texts.en:
Amulasi is 40 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, who are all currently in school. For the past four years, Amulasi has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells beer and other beverages. 

To help expand her business, Amulasi has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beer to sell and will help her to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Amulasi hopes that in the future she will be able to own a larger bar and retail shop. 

Amulasi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Amulasi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 63 years old and is a widow with four adult children. She lives in San Antonio, Siquijor, Siquijor. For the past five years, Milagros has run a sari-sari (variety) store and she earns an average income of PHP 200 daily. She has been an active member of PMPC since 2010.

Milagros is requesting a loan to purchase additional grocery stocks for the business. She has borrowed previously from PMPC and hopes to generate more income to save for the future.

loans.use: to purchaes additonal grocery stocks

loans.name: Saidamir

texts.en:
Saidamir is married and has 3 children to whom he has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. It’s for this reason that 1 years ago he began his own driving business. Some years ago he went to Russia and worked there. He returned to his native town and bought a car of mark BMW for his business. Thanks to his good service, he has managed to gain many customers. Since he’s had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving, and now his children are able to get good meals. 

Saidamir is asking for a loan of 2000 USD to buy a car for developing his business. He is going to rent out his new car. In this way, his business will have the opportunity to provide better service and to increase his income, which will allow him to offer his children and wife a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: buy a car

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
La señora Jenny, es socia del banco comunal “Mujeres De Éxito” del Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 36 años de edad, es separada y tiene dos hijos.
Lleva tres ciclos trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de comida, es propietaria de un restaurant cebichería, que funciona en su casa y al que se dedica todo el día.

Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles comprará: una congeladora pequeña para poder guardar las carnes, chichas y refrescos.
Teniendo su negocio en su misma casa puede  atender a sus hijos para que asistan al colegio sin ningún problema, trabaja todo el día para que nada les falte a sus hijos, en su negocio tiene una persona que le ayuda en la atención de sus clientes, agradece a Manuela Ramos por todo lo que ha conseguido para su familia.  

Nota: en la foto se aprecia un cartel con el nombre de la cebichería ya que es de su propiedad, el letrero es movible.
texts.en:
Jenny’s a member of the “Mujeres De Éxito” (Women of Success) communal bank in Calleria District, Ucayali Deparment.  She’s 36-years-old, separated and has two children.  She’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans for three cycles.  She sells food.  She owns a ceviche [marinated seafood] restaurant that operates at home and that she dedicates all day to.  She will use her new, 1200 new sol, loan to buy a small refrigerator to store her meats, chicha [corn-based beverage] and soft-drinks.

Having a home-based business allows her to care for her children so that they can continue attending school problem-free.  She works all day so that her children will lack nothing.  She has a person in her business that helps with customer service.  She thanks Manuela Ramos for everything she’s obtained for her family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Walisuma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “WALISUMA” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Fanny es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, ladrillera, venta de fruta, tejido de mantas, costura de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Fanny es una integrante, ella indica que hace un año y medio que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio, que inicio con el primer préstamo que hizo en nuestra institución y que en la actualidad le está resultando muy fructífero.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fideo, arroz, azúcar, etc.) que comprará de los almacenes de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente los comercializara en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive con su madre.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio.
texts.en:
The “Walisuma” Community Bank will start its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Community Center. It is composed of nine members and is led by a Board of Directors; Fanny is the secretary of the group. The members engage in different economic activities, such as running a neighborhood store, brick making, selling fruits, blankets weaving and clothes sewing.

Fanny is one of the micro entrepreneurs forming this group, and she will benefit from the requested loan. Fanny says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for one and a half years, and that she has been invited to enter by a friend who was already a member of this institution. She currently runs a neighborhood store, an activity she has started thanks to the first loans she has received form Pro Mujer and which is currently being very profitable.

The loan she is currently requesting will be used to increase her working capital buy buying noodles, rice, sugar and other products. She will buy them in the stores of the town of El Alto to then sell them in her shop. She lives with her mother, and this type of activity helps her earning money to support her family as much as she can.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she enjoys the health clinic.

loans.use: To buy noodles, rice, sugar and other products.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher sells spare auto parts to earn a living. He had previously acquired a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) which helped him to buy shocks, springs and oil for his business. This helped him to grow his business and he was able to make more profits.

He dreams of expanding his business in the future. He has requested another loan of 40,000 KES to buy spraying machines and springs.

loans.use: To buy spraying machines and springs.

loans.name: Djidja Group

texts.fr:
Djidja est un regroupement de femmes  du quartier Koulikoro de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans, sont mariées et mère d’au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers : habits, parures, poissons,  savons, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe.  Kadia est un membre du groupe Djidja, première personne à droite, qui fait de l’habillement et des parures.        
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des colis d’habits et de parures pour enfants pour les revendre.   Elle se procure de ses habits et parures au grand marché de Koutiala et effectue ses ventes  en détail, au comptant et à crédit à la maison et au marché à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djidja comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 210 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Kadia  compte réaliser 240 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement de prêt, elle utilise une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Djidja is a group of women from the Koulikoro neighborhood of the city of Koutiala, who know each other well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are on average 44 years old, married, and mothers to at least four children. This group of women sells sundry items: clothes, jewelry, fish, soap, etc. To increase the size of their businesses, the members decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan. 

Kadia is a member of Djidja, pictured first on the right, who makes clothing and jewelry. She plans to use her loan to purchase parcels of children's clothing and jewelry to resell. She gets her clothes and jewelry at the Koutiala market and conducts her retail sales on a cash and credit basis at home and at the market. Her customers are both male and female. While the other members of the Djidja group hope to make a monthly profit of 210,000 francs CFA each during this cycle, Kadia expects to make 240,000 francs CFA. In addition to loan repayment, she will use a portion of her income to meet her personal expenses and increase her business funds.

loans.use: to buy clothing and jewelry

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is married father of four children living in Hioma,Uganda. He owns a retail shop and has been running it for quite a long time. He faces the challenges of inadequate capital and price fluctuations. Simon hopes to educate his children and build a permanent house while his business plan is to expand to new markets. 
Simon will use his loan to purchase general merchandise such as soap, sugar and cooking oil to .Instead of a still photo the officer in charge took a video.

loans.use: to purchase general merchandise such as soap, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 38 years old and lives in Canunan, Guipos, ZDS. She is married with three children.           
Marites has a vulcanizing business and motorcycle repair business and earns approximately 3000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 8000 PHP to purchase spare parts for her vulcanizing business.    
Marites has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to open new areas of her vulcanizing business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her vulcanizing business.

loans.name: Katonzi Men And Women Group

texts.en: Edmon is a 32-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a photography studio for five years. He started with 1,500,000 shillings and now has 6,000,000 shillings of working capital. His hardships are theft, inadequate capital to purchase modern equipment, and high transportation costs. His personal goal is educating his children and his business goal is diversifying his businesses to include farming. Edmon wants money to buy modern equipment for his studio. He is a member of the above mentioned group, where each member guarantees the others in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy modern equipment for his studio.

loans.name: Maria Fernanda

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 27 años que vive en Santo Domingo con su marido y sus tres hijos. Santo Domingo es la cuarta ciudad más grande de ecuador, esta ha experimentado un crecimiento acelerado en los últimos 15 – 20 años debido al hecho que se encuentra en un punto estratégico que une varias ciudades de la costa y la sierra ecuatoriana. Santo Domingo se centra alrededor de actividades agrícolas y comerciales. La ciudad tiene un clima húmedo tropical y tiene la particularidad de ser un centro donde conviven varias diferentes culturas y tradiciones. 
María trabaja junto con su esposo en el taller de cerrajería que él tiene. María trabaja un promedio de 10 horas diarias, y en el pasado ha asistido a una capacitación de Fundación Alternativa. El préstamo al que María está buscando acceder estaría destinado a la compra de materiales como aluminio y planchas de metal; si María consigue esto, podría expandir la capacidad de su negocio mejorando así sus ganancias lo que le acercaría a su sueño de alguna vez tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
María is a 27-year-old woman who lives in Santo Domingo with her husband and her three children. Santo Domingo is the fourth largest city in Ecuador and it has rapidly grown in the past 15 to 20 years, due to the fact that it's located in a strategic spot uniting various towns of the Ecuadorean coast and mountains. Santo Domingo centers around agricultural and commercial businesses. The town has a tropical humid climate and it has the particular trait of being a centre where many different cultures and traditions live together.
María works alongside her husband in his locksmith's workshop. María works an average of 10 hours a day, and in the past she has attended one of Fundación Alternativa's training courses. The loan María seeks to get would be used to purchase materials such as foil and metal plates. If María achieves that, she would be able to expand her business and therefore improve her profits. This would move her one step closer to her dream of someday owning a house of her own.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's business by purchasing foil and metal plates.

loans.name: Rauben

texts.en:
Rauben is 40 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children - 3 of them are currently in school. For the past 3 years, Rauben has been working hard to manage his small business selling chicken. 

To help expand his business, Rauben has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chickens and feed for resale and will help Rauben to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees. Rauben hopes that in the future he will be able to build a house in his second plot of land. 

Rauben is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rauben who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and feed for resale.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 34 years old, married to Rodgers, a teacher, and they are blessed with two children, aged 10 and 8. She raises poultry, a business she started six years ago, and she earns a monthly income of KES 3,000. 

Anne has requested her first loan, in the amount of KES 5,000, to purchase more chicks and materials for renovating their coop. The anticipated profit will aid her in educating her children. 

Her dream is to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and materials for renovating their coop.

loans.name: Molly

texts.en:
Molly is 39 years old and married with three children between the ages of 9-18.  All of her children attend school. She is pictured with her son.

Molly has raised cattle since 2000 and started the business because it was profitable. Her farm is located in the countryside of Uganda near a small village. Her loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) will allow her to buy more cows and thus provide more meat to her clients who are meat traders.  One difficulty in her business is when her cows get sick and she must spend a lot on vet fees to make them better. This hardworking woman's dream is to buy many more cows than she already has which would increase her profits much more.In the picture is Molly on the left with her son of 16 years in their farm.

loans.use: To buy more cows

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a widow with four children, one of them below the age of 15 years old. She lives with the family in a two-room house. They live in Mankon village in Bamenda, Northwest region of Cameroon.

She has gone through a lot in her life such as the death of her husband, accidents in which some family members were involved, the dilapidating nature of her house, destruction of her farm by cattle, and torments from her late husband's family. however since she joined GHAPE she has been relieved of these trials. This loan will be used to buy and sell second-hand dresses. This activity will help the community in bringing dresses closer to the local market.

The profits from this loan will be used to improve her family’s living standard especially the housing situation, health and educational needs. Parts of it also will be ploughed back onto her business. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest, long term payments and education in some life skills.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand dresses for resale

loans.name: Epifania Morales Luis

texts.es: La socia es del Banco Comunal Tarpuy II, tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y madre de 6 hijos.Es dueña de un negocio de venta de locería, frazadas y otros productos de uso doméstico, también trabaja a base de pedidos. Ella dice que todo este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú pudo educar a sus hijos de manera adecuada y progresar al lado de toda su familia, y mucho de eso lo aprendió con las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio como locería, frazadas, artículos para el hogar.
texts.en: The member is a member of the Communal Bank Tarpuy II.  She is 46 years old and is married and the mother of 6 children.  She owns a business selling pottery, blankets and other products for domestic use.  She also works based on requests.  She says that all this time as a member of FINCA Perú, she has been able to educate her children in an adequate manner and make progress alongside her entire family.  Much of this she learned from the training sessions that she received at her Communal Bank.  The loan that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of merchandise for her business such as pottery, blankets, and other household items.

loans.use: To purchase pottery, blankets, and other household items.

loans.name: Antokia Group

texts.en:
Merina, who is in her late 30s, is married with three children; two of them go to school,  She has had been selling food for about three years now.  She works  from 6.00 am to 8.00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Merina's 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy a sack of rice, maize flour, wheat flour, some kilos of sugar, beans and she paid school fees.  She has repaid all her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to increase chairs, a set of plates and repair her restaurant.  Her dream is to one day be able to open a big restaurant.

She will share this loan with her loan group “Antokia” which has a total of 13 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy  chairs, a set of plates and repair restaurant.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. Evelyn has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP  5,000  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Evelyn  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 53 years old, married and has three children who are in school. For 15 years, he has been practicing dairy farming to earn a living. On the same farm, he also does crop farming. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to grow his business. With the income, he was able to support his family. He dreams of buying more cows in the future. He has requested a loan of 100,000 KES to buy animal feeds and a cow.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds and a cow

loans.name: Ndeye's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été crée le 21 Novembre 2009. Il est composé essentiellement de femmes du quartier ayant de bonnes relations. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, Ndeye Touty est âgée de 50 ans. 

Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont 2 garçons et 2 filles. 

Son crédit reçu, elle va acheter 2 paniers de poissons fumés à 15 000 francs CFA l'unité et 20 kgs de fruits de mer à 1200 francs le kg pour revendre dans sa localité. 

Elle utilise les bénéfices pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group was created on November 21, 2009. It consists mainly of local women who get along nicely. 

Ndeye Touty, age 50, is the group member standing on the right with her hand raised. She is a married mother of four children, two boys and two girls.  

She will use this loan to buy 2 baskets of smoked fish at 15,000 francs CFA each, and 20 kg of seafood at 1,200 francs per kilo. She will sell this merchandise in her neighborhood.  

She will use her profits to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish and seafood for resale.

loans.name: La Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “La Fortaleza” está conformado por 15 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; repostería, venta de estructuras metálicas, mariscos en conserva, corte y confección de ropa, comida rápida, servicio de corte de pasto, peluquería, manicure, hospedaje, venta de perfumes, venta de lanas de oveja, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Osorno.
Karina, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie al fondo del grupo, ocupando el cuarto lugar de derecha a izquierda, lleva puesto un pañuelo en su cuello de color café, usa aros grandes, su cabello es de color oscuro y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de chocolate, tejidos y venta de ropa en general, desde hace 1 año. Comenta que trabaja de lunes a domingo en su casa, y su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en distribuidoras, supermercados y tiendas donde encuentra lanas de todos los colores a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará cobertura de chocolates, moldes, coco, leche condensada, palillos de bambú, lanas y botones.
Una de las metas de Karina son tener un telar grande para poder realizar más tejidos y otros modelos, además que su clientela aprecia su trabajo y le piden otras cosas a parte de lo tradicional de los tejidos.
Karina vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de 11 años de edad, quien se encuentra estudiando. Sus sueños son poder independizarse y especializarse en el rubro de la artesanía y adquirir un local propio donde pueda exponer todo lo que hace y tener más clientela, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Osorno es una ciudad que se ubica en la zona sur de Chile, región de Los Lagos. Es un importante centro agropecuario que se identifica como "La Patria de la Leche y Tierra de la Carne" de Chile. Dentro de su actividad agropecuaria se destaca el cultivo de trigo y avena, la crianza de ganado, para el procesamiento de carnes y lácteos además de la fabricación de equipos agrarios.
Destaca en Osorno el único estadio de fútbol techado de Chile, el Estadio Municipal "Rubén Marcos”.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called “La Fortaleza”, it is made up of 15 business men and women who work in different fields amongst which: confectionary, sale of metallic structures, tinned seafood, cutting and making clothes, fast food, lawn mowing, hairdressing, manicures, bed and breakfast, sale of perfumes, sale of sheep's wool, and services. They are all from the city of Osorno.

Karina, a member of the Communal Bank group, who is standing up at the back of the group in the photo, the fourth person along from right to left, she is wearing a coffee-colored scarf around her neck and large earrings, her hair is dark and is tied up.

For the last year, she has been making her living selling chocolate, fabrics and clothes in general. She comments that she works from Monday to Sunday from her home, and her working hours are allocated according to her availability. She buys the merchandise and supplies she needs from dealers, supermarkets and stores when she finds wools of all types of colors at a low price, as such it is financially interesting. With the loan, she will buy chocolate coating, molds, spatulas, coconut, condensed milk, bamboo sticks, wool and buttons. One of Karina's aims is to have a large loom to be able to make more fabrics and other models, particularly as her customers praise her work and asks her for other items apart from the typical fabrics.

Karina lives with her husband and their 11-year-old son, who is studying at school. She dreams of becoming independent and specializing crafts and buying her own premises who she could display her goods and have a larger customer base, to create more profits and thereby achieve a better quality of life.

She is very pleased and thankful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza, as it will allow her to invest in her business. With respect to the Communal Bank group she belongs to, Karina says that there is an excellent level of communication there. Moreover, the training has helped her to learn new sales and accounting strategies. 

Osorno is a city located in southern Chile, the Los Lagos region. It is an important agricultural and fishing site which identifies itself as Chile's "Home of Milk and Land of Meat". Standing out in its agricultural and fishing activities, is the growing of wheat and oats, cattle rearing for meat and milk products as well as the manufacture of agricultural equipment. Osorno is famous for having Chile's only covered football stadium, the "Rubén Marcos” municipal stadium.

loans.use: Comprará cobertura de chocolates, moldes, coco, leche condensada, palillos de bambú, lanas y botones.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is a widow and has 8 children. She sells limes and yams in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast, which she has done for 22 years. Abena uses her income to pay for all household expenses and for her children's school fees. Abena will use the loan to purchase yams and limes in bulk. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to help her children succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase yams and limes in bulk.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Juan de 41 años de edad, casado, Jornalero, Su esposa es ama de casa, tienen un hijo, habita en la Comarca Chiwawa, pero su trabajo le exige pasar mas tiempo en la zona del Recreo ya que trabaja en el Inta de Jornalero, desde hace 8 años, es una persona trabajadora y esforzada. Tambien cuenta con una pequeña unidad de produccion donde realiza trabajos de campos, produciendo reices y tuberculos estos los comercializa e invierte en su parcela con la ayuda de su esposa.  Solicita este credito ya que esta interesado en comprar un Terreno en el Recreo para ir incrementando su patrimonio. Su sueño es construir una casita aunque sea sencilla pues esta pensando en el bienestar de su familia para un futuro tener que heredarle a su hijo.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan, 41 years old, is married and a day laborer. His wife is a homemaker and they have a son. They live in the Chiwawa region, however his work requires him to spend more time in the El Recreo area because he works in El Inta. He has been a day laborer for eight years and is a hardworking person. He also has a small production unit where he engages in farm work and cultivates root crops and tubers. He sells them and invests in his plot of land with his wife’s help. 

He is applying for this loan because he is interested in buying land in El Recreo in order to increase his estate. His dream is to build a small house, even though it may be simple because he is thinking of his family’s future wellbeing and of passing on an inheritance to his son.

loans.use: to buy a solar system.

loans.name: Badamhand

texts.en: Mrs Badamhand is 51 years old, lives with her husband and a daughter in a small house in Ulaanbaatar, Mongola. Her husband, battogtokh, is 51 years old. He is unworkable. Her daughter, she is 12 years old. She is a second school student. Mrs Badamhand her children clothes retailing business on rental counters in 2002. Nowadays,  She owns two rental counters. Her current assets is 4 300 000 MNT. Thus, She is planning to increase products she sells, she buys her products to offer  for customers.  She is quiet-natured and responsible person. She is asking 4 000 000MNT to purchase more goods from Erlian to offer her business.

loans.use: To purchase more goods from Erlian

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en: Mr.Ganbaatar is 28 years old and lives with his wife and his son in ger, Arhangai province of Mongolia. His wife unemployed and his son goes to the secondary school. He is hairdresser. He is 20-25 people to cut hair. His monthly income is 450,000 - 500,000MNT.   He said, "I want to my hairdresser business, because my customers usually overjoyed". Now his business many regular customer. He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase a hair-dye, barber's goods for hairdresser's tools for his business.  Mr.Ganbaatar goal is expand his business. His local residents appreciates him as a tidy and restraint man.

loans.use: To purchase a hair-dye, barber's goods for hairdresser's tools for his business

loans.name: Erlan

texts.en: Mr.Erlan is 24 years old, lives with his mother and his brother and sister. He is not married. His mother is pension. He has been running the transportation service business from 2009, because he needs to maintain one`s family. In winter time, he is transporting a coal by old Russian truck from the minings and selling to local residents. He transports  10 tons coal in one time. The cost of a ton coal is 23,000 MNT and service price is 60,000 MNT.  In summer time he transports foods and other goods. Now he is asking a 3,000,000 MNT loan for repair his truck and buy spare parts of truck.  Now his business is successfully running because he is a hardworking and popular man.

loans.use: To repair his truck and buy spare parts of truck

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en: Mr. Ganbold is 48 years old and lives with his wife, named Tuya, and three children in a ger district of Huvsgul province, Mongolia. His wife his conductor. His older daughter and son is college student. Since 2008, He conducted a public transport business.  He needs 1,000,000 MNT to purchase the equipment fuel economy for his microbus. Mr.Ganbold's goal is to increase the profit and to save the money for his children's higher education.

loans.use: To purchase the equipment fuel economy for his microbus

loans.name: Serjan

texts.en: Mr. Serjan is 38 years old, lives his wife and 4 children in a little house in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia.   His older daughter Saulogol, 16 years old, secondary school student. His younger daughter Aimoldir and his older son Bekjan,  go to secondary school, aged 14 and 11.  His younger son Birjan stays in the home, and he is 4 years old.  Mr. Serjan started a retailing business in 2002 with help of his wife. He is selling various clothes. And he have a minitruck for his goods transportation. His daily sales income is from 80.000 to 100.000 MNT and his working capital is approximately 5.000.000 MNT. He needs 1 300 000 MNT to buy clothes from Erlian to increase working capital for his business.

loans.use: To buy clothes from Erlian to increase working capital for his business

loans.name: Magsarjav

texts.en: Mrs. Magsarjav is 39 years old and lives with his wife and his children in small house in Khuvsgul, province of Mongolia. His wife helps his business and his children go to the secondary school. He started meat trade business in 1998. He has been well-experienced in meat trade business in his local resident appreciates him as a honest and diligent man. Now, he is business is sustaintle and has many regular customers and suppliers. He is requesting 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase livestocks for his business. He wants save the money for his children's higher education.

loans.use: To purchase livestocks for his business

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en: Mrs.Otgonjargal is 35 years old and lives with her husband and her two children in ger district in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. She also feeds her mother. Her mother retired at the moment. Her husband barber and her chilrens go to the school. She started hairdresser business in 2009. Now her business is sustainable and has many regular customers. She has been well-experienced in hairdresser business her town residents appreciates her a diligent woman. She is requesting 800,000 MNT loan to increase her working capital for hairdresser goods. She wants expand her business and own hairdresser's saloon.

loans.use: To increase her working capital for hairdresser goods

loans.name: Munhdelger

texts.en: Mrs.Munhdelger is 43 years old, lives with her husband and her three children in small house in Arhangai province of Mongolia. Mrs.Munhdelger is a good behaved and hardworking woman. Her husband name is Batmunh, he herdsman. Her older son name is Lhagvadorj, he go to the high school, her older daughter name is Tserendolgor, she goes to the secondary school, her younger daughter named Byambadulam, goes to the secondary school. She started retail trade business in 2010. Her monthly income does not usually meet her family's necessities. She is requesting 3,000,000MNT loan to purchase goods from Ulaanbaatar for her business. Mrs.Munhdelger goal is own grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase goods from Ulaanbaatar for her business

loans.name: Tserenchimed

texts.en: Msr Tserenchimed is 40 years old, lives with her husband and two children in ger in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Her older daughter, Dashpilmaa, is 20 years old. She is a collage student. Her younger daughter, Bertsetseg, is 6 years old. She join a kindergarden. She started a clothes trade business on rental counter in 2010 with her husband. When she start her business her working capital was 500,000 MNT and now has been increased to 2,800,000 MNT. She is hardworking and quiet-natured person, their family is very friendly people.  She is asking 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more goods her business.

loans.use: To purchase more goods her business

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
Irene's group is comprised of four hard working women. Irene is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kinoni in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past two years, Irene has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, soap and rice. 

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities for resale, and will help Irene to generate greater profits and take care of her child and her parents. Irene hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a wholesale shop. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodity like sugar,soap,salt and rice for resale

loans.name: Mama's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Bonna Soforal est créé le 04 décembre 2009. ses membres habitent le même village et sont liés par un bon voisinage. Leur activité principale est le commerce de détail de divers produits saisonniers.
Mme Maïmouna Sibo est l'emprunteur vedette. Elle est âgée de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 03 garçons et 02 filles. Sur la photo, elle est debout à droite, levant la main gauche. 
Elle achète des balais et autres produits saisonniers qu'elle vend à la capital. Elle y achète des chaussures et sacs à main qu'elle vient vendre dans le village. 
Avec les bénéfices, elle va aider son époux à prendre en charge la scolarité et la santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The Bonna Soforal group was created on 4 December 2009. Its members live in the same village and know each other because of good neighborhood relations. Their primary business is to sell all sorts of seasonal products on a retail basis. 

Maïmouna Sibo is the featured borrower. She is 36 years old, married, and the mother of three boys and two girls. In the photo, she is standing on the right, with her left hand raised. She buys brooms and other seasonal products that she sells in the capital. She then buys shoes and handbags to sell back in her village. With the profits, she is going to help her husband provide for their children's schooling and health needs.

loans.use: to buy a variety of goods to sell on a retail basis

loans.name: United Traders Association Group

texts.en:
Members of the United Traders Association are very grateful to Kiva lenders for the previous loan that they received. That loan has made a huge impact in their businesses and personal lives. With the help of that loan, they were able to add more goods to their respective businesses. This led to an increase in sales and profit. They used the profit to repay the loan successfully, feed their children, pay their school charges, etc. 

Having repaid successfully, they are requesting a new loan of 800,000 Sierra Leonean leones each. This new loan will help them further develop their businesses in terms of size and quality.

loans.use: to buy fish wholesale to add to her current stock of fish.

loans.name: Hacienda Campamento Group

texts.es: jghghgh
texts.en: DFADFASD

loans.use: COMPRA DE ABARROTERIA EN GENERAL

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en: Mr Davaasuren is 44 years old, lives with his wife and 4 children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife, Enhtuya, is 40 years old. She is running a tea room. His older son, Enhbold, is 19 years ols. His older daughter, Enhzul, is 15 years old. She is a second school student. His younger daughters, Erdenezul and Uyangaa, aged 13 and 8. They are a school student. He started a pants and pants repair of equipment trade in 2009 with his older son.  He is planning to increase products she sells, she buys her products to offer .  He is hardworking and honest man.  He needs 2 000 000 MNT to buy a raw materials for his business.

loans.use: To buy a raw materials for his business

loans.name: Jeaneth Concepción

texts.es:
Doña Janet, es una mujer muy trabajadora, sigue con sus ventas cada día, en el colegio en un cafetín  vende refrescos, gaseosas, jugos, galletas, golosinas,  siendo lo más consumido por los alumnos. Siempre apoyando a su familia.
Ella ha venido trabajando con financiamiento, otorgados en Afodenic, donde ha logrado hacer mejoras  a su vivienda siendo de gran satisfacción al estar en mejores condiciones, su esposo ahora trabaja de albañil independiente, hay semanas que no tiene trabajos, pero gracias al apoyo de su esposa salen adelantes con los gastos. Sus hijos casados, una de ella vive al fondo del patio en un pequeño cuarto.
Con este nuevo préstamo comenzara la construcción de un nuevo cuarto amplio, ya que el que tiene es muy angosto. Comprara materiales de construcción en piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Doña Janet is a very hardworking woman, and she continues with her sales every day. At a cafe at the school she sells drinks, soda, juice, cookies, and sweets, which are the most popular among the students. She is always supporting her family. 

She has been working with financing granted by AFODENIC, and has succeeding in making improvements to her home. It is very satisfying to be in better conditions. Her husband continues to work as an independent builder. There are weeks when he doesn't have any work, but thanks to the support of his wife they are staying on top of the bills. Their children are married, and one of them lives in the back of the yard in a small room. 

With this new loan she will start construction of a new, spacious room, as the one that he has is very tight. She will buy construction materials like stone, sand, cement, and iron, and start the work.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a new room.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese is 58 years old and married. She has ten children.
 
She has a small garden where she grows taro plants that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Akenese needs a loan to expand her business.
 
She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. Akenese will use the profits from her sales to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy oil, a frying pan, plastic bags and salt.

loans.name: Ram Kumari

texts.en:
Ram Kumari is 47 years old and lives in the village of Kalaiya in the Terai region of Nepal. She lives with her husband and has four children, with three of them currently in school. For the past three years she has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells household essentials such as maize flour, sugar, soap, etc. 

Ram Kumari  has requested a loan of 40,000 NPR to help expand her business. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like flour, dry beans, rice, and sugar for resale. This will help her to generate income to help pay school fees for her children. She hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a wholesale shop that carries more goods.

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Sharda Devi

texts.en:
Sharda has always loved business and therefore, she opened a small shop with a few groceries over five years ago in the same village where she lives. There were few stores when she opened, and this, combined with her dedication and hard work, allowed her to maintain a wide clientele. Since her husband is a farmer, her produce is always fresh.

She manages her business 6 a.m. until 9 p.m. while also looking after her children. Her merchandise comprises basic commodities, so she sells mostly rice, sugar, canned goods, vegetables, cleaning supplies, etc. She is requesting this loan to expand her stock to include other items. She hopes her business will be more profitable and also wants to help her husband prosper by expanding it.

loans.use: To expand her grocery business.

loans.name: Dhanmanti

texts.en:
Dhanmanti is a 43-year-old woman. She is married and a mother of two sons and three daughters. 

For the past five years, she and her family members have been working in agriculture, which has been a profitable project. But they need more support to cover their costs. So Dhanmanti is requesting a. 20,000 NPR loan. The loan will help Dhanmanti purchase seasonal seedlings, seeds, and fertilizers. The loan will help them grow vegetables, which will provide income to live in better conditions.

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Mayapati Devi

texts.en:
Mayapati is 27 years old. She is married and lives in a small village of the Bara District of Nepal with her husband, Mahesh, and four children. Two of her children study in the local school. 

Mayapati and Mahesh run a small vegetable farm where they grow maize, tomatoes, and potatoes. The family has a bull-cart which they use for transportation of vegetables and fruits to nearby villages for selling. The total average monthly income of the family is 5,000 NPR.

Mayapati requested a loan for purchasing fertilizers to increase her vegetable and fruit production. After fertilization and properly done seasonal agricultural work, they hope to get a good harvest. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income, they will be able to finance the studies of their children. Thus, they will be able to create better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Tua

texts.en: Tua is a 19-year-old woman who is married with no children. She has a small business, doing Ava Samoa liquid store. She has 2 years with this business. Tua needs a loan to buy more ava samoa, plastic bags, labels and etc. She will use her profits to expand the business. Tua joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: plastic bags, labels, gloves,..

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en: Matalena is a 50-year-old woman who is married with six children. She runs a business clothing in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. Matalena has requested a loan to buy more secondhand clothes and etc. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy cloths, sewing machine, and needles

loans.name: Lusi

texts.en: Lusi is 28 years old and married with five children. She runs a small business selling fa'alifu (cooked taro, banana, and yam with coconut cream) in her community and has been doing this for four years. Lusi has requested a loan to buy bananas, taro, yams, etc. She joined SPBD in (year) to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lusi will expand the business.

loans.use: to buy bananas, taro, yams, salts

loans.name: Betty S.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers from one of the primary schools in Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, to seek a second loan of 18,000,000 SLL from SMT/Kiva lenders.  Kiva loans provide these school teachers with the means of buying or investing in projects that they cannot afford with their salaries alone. At the end of each month, their school's bursar deducts the borrowers’ monthly repayments and remits them to SMT on their behalf. 
  
Betty, 57 years old, is the leader of this group of teachers. A native of Damawulo village, she has been in the teaching profession for 36 years. Betty is married and has 4 children – 2 in primary school and 2 in secondary school. Betty has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en: Mrs.Narantuya is 52 years old, lives with her daughter in Hovd province. Her daughter is managing a her own private trading business. Mrs Narantuya is widow. Before she was a sewer in the state industry. When she retired on a pension, she started her sewing service micro business at home.  Because she is experienced with too many years in the sewing industry, she has been gaining more customers from day ti day.  Mainly she produces the Deel /Mongolian national clothes/. She requests a 1.000.000 MNT loan to purchase raw materials. She is a amiable and public woman.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Naajav

texts.en: Mrs.Naajav is 43 years old and lives with her husband and her childrens in ger district in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband works for a private company and her two children a college's students and her younger son go to the secondary school. She started her own retail trade business in 2004 in her local trade center. Before she got loan 800,000 MNT and had been paying her debt on time. Currently, she has been well-experienced in retail grocery trade business in her local residents appreciates her as a openly and friendly woman. Today, Mrs.Naajav needs 3,600,000 MNT loan to purchase the goods for her retail grocery business.

loans.use: To purchase the goods for her retail grocery business

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is from Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 42 years old. Emma is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Emma makes and sells ice cream. Emma has been engaged in her business for 11 years and earns 16,000 a month for these activities. In 2010, Emma joined GDMPC. Emma is requesting a loan of 30,000 which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Munhtuul

texts.en: Mrs.Munhtuul, 33 years old, lives with three children in a ger in Dundgobi province of Mongolia. Her older son goes to secondary school and her younger son and daughter stays at home.  She graduated from Hobby college in Ulaanbaatar. Mrs.Munhtuul started a hair salon business in 2002. She is well known to costumers. She has already been many regular costumers and suppliers. Now, she is preparing to start beauty salon business.  She is honest, and her family is hardworking people. She is asking for 2 500 000 MNT to increase the working capital to purchase a beauty salon equipments.

loans.use: To increase the working capital to purchase a beauty salon equipments

loans.name: Dolgormaa

texts.en: Mrs.Dolgormaa is 25 years old and lives with her husband and her son in ger district in province of Mongolia. Her husband works for police, named Nemehbayar, 27 years old, he monthly income is 450,000 MNT. Her son goes to the kindergarten, he is 1 years old. She started her own clothes trade business in 2001. Today, She has been well-experienced in clothes trade business her local residents appreciates her as a modesty and diligent woman. Now her business is sustainable and has many regular customers. She is requesting 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a goods for her own clothes trade business.

loans.use: To purchase a goods for her own clothes trade business

loans.name: Dulamsuren

texts.en: Mrs.Dulamsuren is 32 years old and lives with her husband and her children in small house in Dornod province of Mongolia. Her husband name is Gombosuren, he works for a private company as a civil assistant. But Mrs.Dulamsuren and her husband are invalid. Her daughter goes to the secondary school and her son goes to the kindergarten. She started her own grocery retail trade business in 2007. She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase goods for her grocery retail trade business. She goal is expand her grocery retail trade business the profit and to save the money for build a grocery house. She is hardworking and tidy woman.

loans.use: To purchase goods for her grocery retail trade business

loans.name: Batchuluun

texts.en: Mrs. Batchuluun lives with 3 children in the eastern province of Mongolia. 3 years ago her husband passed away from factory accident. So she needs to maintain one's family and pay 3 children`s school fee. Currently she worked in little factory of ice cream. But this work was seasonal and the salary was small in wintertime.  Therefore she has started a ready made clothes trading business in 2010. She rents a place in the market and her working capital is about 3,000,000 MNT. Now she requests a 2.500.000 MNT for import the goods from China, because school season will start in September. Mrs.Batchuluun is a healthful, willpower woman. She wishes to have her children go to school and to become an education citizens.

loans.use: To import the goods from China

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en: Erdenetsetseg is 56 years old and lives with her two daughter and two nephew in a house in Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. She started her business in 1996 by selling meat at the local black market. Her daily sales is from 20 to 30 kg. She is gradually expanding her business. She has many regular suppliers and buyers. She want to expand own business." She is requesting a 2,000,000MNT loan to purchase meat for her business.  She has been doing this business consistently. She is a hard-working and energetic woman.

loans.use: To purchase more meat.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is from Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is 31 years old. Eden is married and has 3 children. To make a living, she owns and operates a upholstery shop. She has been in her business for 7 years and earns 10,000 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Eden joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 which will be used to obtain materials for her shop. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to obtain materials for her shop

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en: Mrs Lhagvasuren is 40 years old, with lives her husband and daughter, in own ger  in Zavhan province of Mongolia. Her Husband's Tumenhuu is security guard, and 40 years old.  Her daughter's named Ayush. She is a high school student, and 18 years old. In 2007,  She started her car oiling accessories business in the nearby trading center. Now she owns one rental counter in the trading center of the western region of the country. She is well known to costumers. She has already been many regular costumers and suppliers. She is planing to expand her business. She is a very hard-working, responsible women. She requesting 2 000 000MNT, to purchase a more oil and other material to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase a more oil and other material to increase her working capital

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Rugiatu.  She is married, with two children, ages 24 and 19. 

In 1996, Rugiatu established her nails and empty five gallon rubber business. She began her business just to support her children’s education and as one source of income. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 640,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Rugiatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan.  She now requires a new loan in order to buy five gallon rubber and nails. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 320,000. 

In the future, Rugiatu plans to assist her husband complete the construction of their second compound, and to support their kids' education.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy empty gallons and roofing nails

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel's main source of income comes from making and selling snacks and delicacies in her community. She is 36 years old and married, and she has two school-age children. They are from the village of Kauswagan in Dapitan City.
In 2011, Annabel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabel is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Morayo Nafissatou Alakè

texts.fr: Morayo Nafissatou Alakè est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée à un certain Idriss. Morayo Nafissatou Alakè est mère de deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé et tous à la charge du couple. Morayo Nafissatou Alakè vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari, les divers besoins du ménage. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins, Morayo Nafissatou Alakè vend depuis trois ans, des tissus, des vêtements, des chaussures et des bijoux dans son quartier. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Morayo Nafissatou Alakè s’approvisionne au Bénin, mais aussi au Togo et au Nigeria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Morayo Nafissatou Alakè sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle et son revenu.
texts.en:
Morayo Nafissatou Alakè is 34 years of age, and is married to Idriss. She is a mother to two children, one of whom is at school and both are under the care of the couple. She lives with her husband and children and, together with her husband, covers the various household expenses. 

To provide for her family, for the past three years Morayo Nafissatou Alakè has worked selling fabrics, clothing, shoes and jewelry in her neighborhood. This business allows her to meet her needs without any great difficulty. 

Morayo Nafissatou Alakè gets her supplies in Benin, as well as in Togo and Nigeria. In order to satisfy her customers and increase her turnover and income, she has asked for her first loan from Alidé. This loan will allow her to increase her business levels, as well as to have more customers and higher income.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, clothing, shoes and jewelry.

loans.name: Estelvinai Irene

texts.es:
Estelvina ha trabajado mucho, para apoyar a su familia, a sus 52 años, sigue trabajando en la venta de ropa y cosméticos, carteras y otros productos por encargo, casada, su esposo trabaja de albañil, dos de su tres hijos están casado, el otro vive con ellos.
Desde que comenzo lo hizo  atraves del financiamiento en Afodenic, lo que logrado viajar hasta el país de Panamá a comprar la ropa y perfumes, comprando a un costo bajo y vendiendo a un precio accesible, obteniendo buenos resultados.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara: seis docenas de pantalón de damas y caballeros, cinco docenas camisas de varón, seis docenas de camisa de damas, ropa interior y cosméticos. Con el objetivo de vender, para mantener el equilibrio de su negocio y cumplir con sus compromisos de pagos.
texts.en:
Estelvina has worked hard to support her family.  At her 52 years, she is continuing to work selling clothing, cosmetics, purses and other products that her customers order from her.

She is married, and her husband is a construction worker.  They have three children, two of whom are married; the other lives with them.

From the time she started her business, she has made use of financing from Afodenic.  This has enabled her to travel to the country of Panama to buy clothing and perfumes at a low cost so that she can sell these items at accessible prices.  She has achieved good results through this approach.

With this new loan she will buy the following items to resell:

Six dozen pairs of men's and women's pants
Five dozen men's shirts
Six dozen women's blouses
Underwear
Cosmetics

This will enable her to maintain her business and make her loan payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing, cosmetics and perfumes so that she can continue growing her sales.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Mra Narantsetseg is 39 years old, lives with her husband and 4 children in ger in Zavhan province, Mongolia. Her husband, Namgurajaw, is 39 years old. He is keeper in a Hospital. Her older daughter, Ariuntsatsaral, is 17 years old. She is a collage student. Her two sons, Bazarragchaa and Delgersaihan, aged 16 and 14. They are join a second school. Her younger daughter, Saruuljargal, is 13 years old. She is a second school student. She started  a clothes retail business on rental counter in 2011. Now that her income is stable, she wants to expand her range of products.  She is a responsible person, their family is sociability and hardworking people. She is asking 2 000 000 MNT to buy more goods to offer for her business.

loans.use: To buy more goods to offer for her business

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en: Mrs.Tsetsegmaa aged 27, lives with her husband and a daughter in a GER /Mongolian national yurt/ in Uvurhangai province. Her daughter is 2 years old and stays at home. Mrs.Tsetsegmaa operates organic yogurt and organic milk sale business from 2011. Her husband starting his own business in May, this year. He is providing the small tire repairing service. Her husband rents a space along the central road to grow the volume of sales. As a result, he has been gaining more customers from day to day. Tsetsegmaa also runs the business to saw firewood for rural residents in winter time. Now mrs.Tsetsegmaa wants to help his husband business to improve his business and to cell tires of car. She is requesting a 1.000.000 MNT to purchase more tires for his husband business.

loans.use: To purchase more tires for his husband business

loans.name: Bayanbish

texts.en: Bayanbish is 37 years old and lives with 4 children and wife in a ger in Darhan province, Mongolia. His wife, Masar, is 37 years old. She is an unemployed. His daughters, Ariunzaya and Amarzaya, aged 17 and 15 responsive.They are a second school student. His sons, Gonchigsumlaa and Bayarjargal, aged 13 and 3. Gonchogsumlaa is a second school student. Bayarjargal is join a kindergarden.He has been serving as a taxi driver after purchased a car. He is well-experienced and popular in the town. He is a diligent man who is requesting a 1,400,000MNT loan to purchase spare parts for his a car.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his a car

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en: Mrs Altantuya, age 39, lives with her husband and two children in a rental home in Ulaanbaatar. Her husband is driver and her older daughter is college student, her younger daughter is secondary school student. Altantuya started her second hand clothes retailing business in 2011. Currently, her daily sales incom is 15.000-20.000 MNT. She has many regular suppliers and buyers. She is requesting a 700.000MNT to increase her working capital, because during the new session, her business demand increases. Thus, He wants to buy more products she sells in order to increase my business income as well as profit. Her husband helps with her business. She is a friendly and brave woman who says, "When my business expands in the next few years, I will build a own apartment for my family."

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes to increase her working capital
