texts.en: Due to cultural reasons Jamieleh prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Jamieleh is a 46-year-old married woman who has five family members. She is from Al Koorah, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy new electronics. In the future she hopes to repaint her home.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: San Judas Tadeo Group

texts.es: La Sra. Jasmin es casada 24, tiene 24 años de edad  y 1 hijo Jasmin   es integrante  del grupo “San Judas Tadeo”, grupo conformado por 9 socios que se dedican a diversas    actividades de comercio.  Jasmin  se dedica a la venta y preparación de comida es decir vende almuerzos, también vende gaseosas este negocio está situado en su  casa y tiene clientes fidelizados, Liseth inicio este negocio hace 4 meses a su vez también trabaja en una orquesta donde ella es cantante. El sueño de Liseth es con el tiempo ser  una mejor cantante y afrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para  comprar insumos y platos cubiertos. Jasmin cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y agrade el préstamo a  Edaprospo y kiva.
texts.en:
Ms. Jasmin Liseth is married, 24 years of age, and has one child. Jasmin is a member of the group "San Judas Tadeo" made up of nine members who earn their living at a variety of commercial activities. Jasmin earns a living by selling and preparing food, that is to say, she sells lunches. She also sells soft drinks. This business is located in her home and she has loyal customers. 

Jasmin Liseth began this business four months ago and at the same time she works for an orchestra where she is a singer. Liseth's dream is to be a better singer in time and offer a better quality of life to her family. In hopes of continuing to grow she has requested a new loan to purchase supplies and covered dishes. Jasmin Lisbeth will reach her goals with much work and effort. She is grateful to Edaprospo and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and covered dishes.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Angeles has a small store that sells different kinds of viands. She has had this business for 9 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients in making viands like meat, vegetables and spices.

Angeles is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients in making viand

loans.name: Holiday Inn Group

texts.en:
Jumanne, who is in his early 40's, is a widower with one child who is in school.   He has been running two businesses--fishing and also selling charcoal. He has been in his business for ten years now.  He works from 11 a.m to 2 p.m. daily, and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy more trees for making more charcoal and bought fishing net, and he has paid back all his loans successfully.  He hopes for a loan to increase his charcoal selling and to sell more fish.  His dream is to one day be able to become an international businessman.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Holiday Inn," which has a total of ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on charcoal selling and to sell more fish.

loans.name: Ayub

texts.en:
Ayub is 24 years of age, married and blessed with a one year old child. He owns a carpentry shop, a business he started four years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 12,000. 

He has requested a second loan of KES. 40,000 to purchase a plane and smoothing machine for the workshop. 

The profit he earns will aid him to repay his loan and expand his workshop. His dream is to see his business succeed.

loans.use: To purchase a plane and smoothing machine.

loans.name: Alogojesuton 4 Group

texts.fr: ALOGOJESUTON 4 est un groupement de quarante personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. Le représentant du groupe, Cyrille (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgé de 43 ans et est marié  une revendeuse du nom de Virginie. Cyrille est père de trois enfants tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple. Cyrille vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges. Cyrille a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Il y a quelques années que Cyrille mène comme activité la vente des articles de quincaillerie, des céréales (maïs, haricot) et des condiments dans un marché du Bénin. Cyrille mène cette activité afin de pouvoir aux besoins du ménage. Cyrille s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Cyrille sollicite un deuxième crédit avec les autres membres du groupement ALOGOJESUTON 4. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Le crédit précédent a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
ALOGOJESUTON 4 is a group of 40 people, whose members live in the same neighborhood in Bénin. The representative of the group, Cyrille (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 43 years old and is married to a reseller named Virginie. Cyrille is father to three children who are all in school and is responsible for the couple. Cyrille lives together with his children and his wife. The couple takes care of the diverse responsibilities together. Cyrille stopped school at the secondary level. 

For several years Cyrille has been managing a business selling hardware, cereals (corn, beans) and condiments in a market in Bénin. Cyrille practices this business in order to be able to take care of the needs of the household. Cyrille gets his supplies in a market in Bénin. In seeking to satisfy his clientèle, Cyrille is requesting a second loan with the other members of the ALOGOJESUTON 4 group. This loan will help them to better meet the demands of their clientèle and to make more profits. The previous loan was well repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn and condiments.

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en: Ms Munawar is 42 years old. She is a housewife and a mother of four. Her husband has been selling crockery for many years. He offers various sizes of plates, boxes, and cooking utensils of steel. He has a good client list and is famous for his good quality products. Now he needs to buy more stock of steel products to cater to more customers. However, his resources restrict him from doing so. That is why Munawar, on behalf of her husband, requested a loan of Rs 30,000/- to buy more stock of steel crockery. He is hoping to earn more profits through his increased sales. He dreams of  providing his children with a good quality education.

loans.use: To buy steel crockery at lower rates

loans.name: Awadagbe Ii Group

texts.fr: AWADAGBE II est un groupement de quatorze personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même village au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Mariam (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 62 ans et est une veuve. Mariam est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Mariam vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule ses divers besoins ainsi que ceux de  ses enfants. Il y a cinq années que Mariam mène comme activité la vente de la farine de manioc et de l’huile végétale dans un quartier du Bénin. Mariam s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Mariam mène cette activité afin de pouvoir aux besoins de ses enfants. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Mariam sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupement AWADAGBE II. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
AWADAGBE II is a group of fourteen persons whose members reside in the same village in Benin. The group's representative, Mariam (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 62 years old, a widow, and the mother of three children, all with education and in her care. Mariam lives alone with her children and ensures by herself that her diverse needs are met, as well as those of her children. 

For five years, Mariam has had a business selling cassava flour and vegetable oil in a district in Benin. She gets her supplies from a region in Benin. She works in order to be able to meet her children's needs. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers, Mariam is requesting, along with the other members of the group AWADAGBE II, an initial loan for responding better to customer demands and making more profit.

loans.use: to purchase cassava flour and peanut oil to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, and four of her children go to school. She has one additional family member. She sells charcoal from home. She sells her products on a retail basis. She also gets additional income from selling vegetables and fruits from home. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to buy a delivery van to ease with transportation. She lives in her own house, and her family has access to electricity but doesn’t have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Smart Ladies Group

texts.en:
Smart ladies was formed in 2001 by by young ladies who were in the same college and it has been a strong group of professionals.Despite being employed they have a group business that help them earn an extra coin.During one of their visits to their relatives in upcountry they discovered a neighbour using biogas and it was so economical.
The neighbour was a member of VEP who referred them to us and they joined VEP in 2011.They have been very active members of VEP and want to construct biogas to their parents.By constructing biogas this will improve livelihoods of their parents who are all in upcountry and this will also improve their health since they will stop using firewood that emmits carbon monoxide that have hazzardious to their health.

loans.use: To pay for biogas digester for their parents

loans.name: Radhika

texts.en:
Radhika is 48 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 24 and 26 years. In 2000, she established  her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Radhika plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks lenders for their support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
Fanny montó la tienda general hace más o menos 12 años por la necesidad de comenzar a generar ingresos para su hogar, pues los ingresos de su esposo estaban siendo insuficientes para sostener la familia. Con la tienda, a pesar de que no tenía nada de conocimientos y también muy poquito capital, ha podido ir sacando adelante a su hijo y mejorar la calidad de vida del hogar, y esto la motiva para poder seguir saliendo adelante. Fanny está pasando en el momento por grandes dificultades económicas, las cuales la están haciendo pasar por grandes necesidades, y por esto con la necesidad de mejorar sus ventas busca un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar y abastecer su tienda con productos que se han ido agotando, de esta manera podrá superar las grandes dificultades económicas que tiene en su negocio en el momento.

Su sueño es llegar a tener un minimercado donde puedan aumentar sus ingresos y también tenga la posibilidad de generar empleo para los más necesitados.
texts.en:
Fanny opened the general store more or less 12 years ago because she needed to begin to earn income for her household. Her husband’s income was insufficient to maintain the family. Apart from the fact that she was not knowledgeable and had little capital, the store allowed her to get her son ahead and improve the quality of life of her household. This is her motivation to keep getting ahead. 

Fanny is currently undergoing difficult financial times. For this reason she is looking to improve her sales with a loan to purchase basic items and supply her store. 

Her dream is to have a mini-market where they can increase their income and also have the possibility to create employment for those most in need.

loans.use: Para comprar productos de la canasta familiar y abastecer su tienda con productos que se han ido agotando, de esta manera podrá superar las grandes dificultades económicas que tiene en su negocio en el momento.

loans.name: Rolly Raul

texts.es:
Rolly es un hombre de 26 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Rolly pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación Rolly trabaja como gestor de cobranza en una empresa de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien porque es muy responsable.
Rolly se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de prendas de vestir para su venta, tales como polos, pantalones, shorts, blusas, etc. Tanto para damas y caballeros; de esta manera Rolly tendrá la mercadería necesaria para iniciar su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, así él espera poder venderlas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que Rolly pueda cumplir su gran sueño de tener si casa propia.
texts.en:
Rolly is 26 years old and single, and lives in the city of Pucallpa.  He is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to excel in life.  Thanks to his own efforts and the support of their parents, Rolly was able to pursue a professional degree.  In his spare time, he enjoys playing soccer with his friends, and sometimes cooks up a delicious ceviche (traditional seafood dish) to share with his family.

By his own initiative, and with much effort and dedication, Rolly works as a collections manager for a company in his city.  He starts working every day in the early morning, and he works for about 8 hours.  He believes that he is doing well at his job because he is very responsible.

Rolly is grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their assistance, he will be able to purchase clothing for resale in his shop, such as shirts, pants, shorts, blouses, etc. for both ladies and gentlemen.  In this way, Rolly will have the merchandise needed to start a small business selling clothes.  He hopes to sell them and increase his income, which will help to fulfill Rolly's dream of owning his own home.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as polo shirts, pants, shorts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. Felisa has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for nine years. 

She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Felisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Felisa hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods,snacks and beverages

loans.name: Majani Ya Chai Group

texts.en:
Ally was born in 1949, and is married with eight children, of which six are in school while the others are independent adults.   He has been running genge-duka (fruits and vegetable) business since 1970.   He works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily, and he is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

He requests the first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he wants to use to increase his stock of genge-duka items for his business.  His dream is to one day be able to own a food shop.

He will share this loan with his loan group " Majani Ya Chai " which has 19 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his stock of genge-duka items for his business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 44-year-old married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from 12 years to 18 years. She describes herself to be a confident woman.

She operates a poultry business in which she sells chickens. She has been involved in this business for one year and employs one staff member. Her business is located at a strategic area, and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 12,900 Kenyan shillings loan to buy a solar lamp, which will be used by her family members. Her business goal is to be a supplier of chickens to customers within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will run a butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a 30-year-old married man. He has a child who is  years old. He describes himself to be a faithful man. He operates a retail business where he sells fertilizers, farm seeds, pesticides, etc. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located at a viable business area, and his primary customers are local residents and farmers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be delay of payments from customers. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides. His business goal is to improve his business within five years. This is his  second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Seynabou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe crée depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois il regroupe des femmes du même Village s'activant dans le commerce et l'embauche. Elles sont unis par de bonnes relations et partagent le même banc villageois.
Madame Diarra est une femme mariée âgée de 46 ans et mère de 3 enfants dont 2 filles et 1 garçon. Elle est debout à l’extrême droite de la photo habillé en camisole blanche. Elle s'active dans l'embauche bovine depuis longtemps et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce secteur. Son nouveau crédit de 300000 francs CFA lui permettra de payer des bœufs et un mouton qu'elle va élever et revendre plus tard. Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettra de payer les fournitures scolaires de ses enfants et de payer la nourriture à sa famille.
texts.en:
This group was created during the first cycle of the Banc Villageois.  It consists of women from the same village who are involved in retail business and the fattening of livestock.  They are bound by good relationships and belong to the same Banc Villageois.

Diarra is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of three children (two girls and a boy).  In the photo, she is standing at the far right and dressed in white.  She has been involved in fattening livestock for a long time and has a good experience in this field.

With her new loan of 300,000 CFA francs she will buy oxen and a sheep, which she will raise and ultimately resell.  Generated profits will allow her to buy school supplies for her children and feed her family.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening up.

loans.name: Hiam

texts.en: Hiam is a 38-year-old, married woman who has 5 family members from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1,200 JOD to buy clothes and blankets to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same of area she wants to expand her project. In the future, she hopes to open a project and to buy a home for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes and blankets to resell

loans.name: Khlood

texts.en:
The above photo with her husband. Khlood is a 25-year-old, married woman from Al Aqaba, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for her home improvement. She would like to buy a new refrigerator and some household items. In the future, she wants to improve her family's social economic status.

Since Khlood is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Ablah

texts.en: Ablah is a 55 year old married woman from Al Aqaba, Jordan who has 1 family member. She is requesting a loan of 1000 JOD to buy materials for embroidery and expand her business. She currently sells her products in her home and in the future, wants to open a big shop to show her products and increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy materials for embroidery.

loans.name: Kahrman

texts.en: Kahrman is a 52 year old married woman who has two family members from Ashrafia Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JD to pay for materials that will allow her to arrange flowers and to buy antiques to sell. She would like to sell her products to the shops near her and in other areas. In the future, she hopes to open a small shop to show her products and to increase her family income.

loans.use: to pay for the materials for her to sell her flower arrangements.

loans.name: Ushindi Stars Group

texts.en:
Ushindi Stars is a group of women who are self motivated despite the fact that they are singles.They are united and have started a business together where they knit table clothes and sell thereby earning a living.Ushindi stars group is a member of VEP and would like to buy cooking stoves for sale.By getting the loan they will buy stoves which they will distribute to other women thereby improving livelihoods of the end users of stove.
Ushindi stars will comfortably pay the loan from sales of jikos and table clothes.

loans.use: To pay for firewood jikos

loans.name: Boffel Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité faisant partie du Banc Villageois Boffel existe depuis le 30 décembre 2009 date de son inauguration. Il est constitué de vingt trois femmes qui habitent le même village et leurs activités principales sont l'agriculture, l'élevage et le petit commerce.

Madame Sénéba la responsable est âgée de 52 ans, c'est une femme divorcée mère de neuf enfants dont une fille .Elle s'active dans le petit commerce de savon, de fruits et légumes et fait aussi de l'embouche ovine. Sur la photo, elle est debout à droite habillée en bleu imprimé et a levé la main droite.

Elle achète le savon, les fruits et légumes aux marchés hebdomadaires de Gouye Mbeuth et Thiamène;elle revend dans le village.


Avec son prêt elle envisage acheter 4 moutons pour embouche ovine et compte les vendre d'ici l'année prochaine pour espérer beaucoup de revenus.


Avec ses bénéfices elle a les charges de la famille (nourriture,santé, habillement); renforce son épargne.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is part of the "Banc Villageois" Boffel and exists since December 30, 2009 when it was created. It consists of 23 women who live in the same village and their main businesses are agriculture, breeding and shopkeeping.

Sénéba is responsible for the group and is 52 years old. This is a divorced woman and mother to 9 children of whom 1 is a girl. She is active in shopkeeping selling soap, fruits and vegetables, and also fattens sheep. In the photo, she is standing to the right dressed in patterned blue and has raised her right hand.

She buys soap, fruits and vegetables at the weekly markets of Gouye Mbeuth and Thiamène; she resells in her village.

With her loan she envisions buying 4 sheep for ovine fattening and plans to sells them by next year and hopes to bring in a lot of income.

With her profits she has the responsibilities of the family (food, health, clothing) and strengthens her savings.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening.

loans.name: Machinery Group

texts.en:
Machinery group was started in 2010.It is a very powerful group of VEP.The group entertains others during fuctions for a pay and also they rear rabbits for sale.
The group needs a loan of Kshs:495,000 to buy 165 cooking stove for sale.The group is determined to change life of those who are using three stone firewood jiko to use the improved cooking stove which is economical and for good health.
Monthly they will be ble to repay the loan issued at ease from the sales made from jikos and rabiits and also from income received after entertainment.

loans.use: To pay for cooking stove

loans.name: Beata

texts.en:
With her husband’s many years of rope-climbing experience and techniques for dealing with heights, Beata, 40, decided to take his talents and create a wind turbine cleaning service in Savannah, Texas.

Originally from Poland, Beata and her family moved to Texas in June of 2011. She began planning her new business three years ago, but only recently was able to launch it with the help of an Accion Texas loan. Her company, "Beata S. Climbex", currently only employs her husband and herself, but she hopes to create more jobs in the future. 

Beata and her husband’s past experience working with ropes inspired Beata to enter the wind energy industry, but the necessity of finding a job in a new country led her to take action in creating the business. She says, “I wanted to utilize the skills we possess and be able to make a decent living.”

In her business, Beata says she is attempting to "go green" by using environmentally-friendly products to clean wind blades with steam. She says it would have been far more difficult to start her company without Accion Texas, which she discovered through an Internet search. With her approved loan in hand, Beata was able to pay for start-up costs and insurance.

loans.use: to pay for insurance and working capital.

loans.name: Milixa Yamixela

texts.es:
Milixa es una mujer de 21 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de su familia, Milixa pudo estudiar una carrera técnica, en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando música y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Milixa trabaja como asistente contable en una empresa de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana asiste a su centro de trabajo inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien porque se siente a gusto realizando su labor.    
Milixa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de la vivienda de sus abuelos, ya que actualmente la casa de ellos es de esteras y madera; de esta manera ella espera poder realizar una construcción con materiales adecuados y resistente, que brinden mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así ella espera lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración y tener su propio negocio de venta de comida.

loans.use: Para realizar la construccion de su vivienda.

loans.name: Milagro De Dios Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Milagro de Dios esta conformado por 10 integrantes de  los cuales 9 son mujeres. Con 18 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Estos son originarios del Sauce, que esta ubicado en la zona norte del país. Lugar que se caracteriza por ser productor de maíz , leche, cuajada, crema todos derivados de la leche, y la crianza de cerdos. Los integrantes del banco comunal Milagro de Dios  son personas muy honradas, trabajadoras, gente muy sencillas, con ganas de superación. Reyna Isabel es la coordinadora del banco comunal Milagro de Dios ella se encarga de la responsabilidad de los integrantes en cuanto a sus pagos en tiempo y forma. Reyna tiene por actividad económica la elaboración de tortillas actividad que la desempeña desde hace 8 anos, el cual ha sido su medio de vida en la actualidad. La rutina de Reyna Isabel es salir levantarse a las 4: 00 am a preparar el maíz para la elaboración de las tortillas, posteriormente  las vende en su casa de habitación a clientes fijos y eventuales. En la foto observamos a Reyna Isabel en la elaboración de sus tortillas. Los  integrantes del banco comunal Milagro de Dios agradece la ayuda que brindan los inversionistas kiva  a personas de escasos recurso y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno para poder sobrevivir en país con tantas limitantes y carencias económicas y fuentes de trabajo.

loans.use: para invertir en la compra y venta de cerdos en pie. para destace y  comercializar sus productos

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 32 años que alcanzó a terminar la primaria, está separada de su pareja y tiene un hijo con quien vive en  Otavalo un cantón de la provincia de Imbabura, una provincia que se encuentra al norte de la República del Ecuador. En Otavalo la mayoría de sus habitantes son indígenas y es el pueblo más rico en todo el país donde se fabrican gran cantidad de artesanías que son exportadas y son muy cotizadas internacionalmente y que también se venden en esta ciudad a los turistas que pasan por allí. El turismo es una fuente muy importante de ingresos ya que es visitada por personas nacionales e internacionales por sus atractivos centros turísticos en la ciudad como sus arquitectónicas calles y cascadas y ríos fuera de la ciudad. Las fiestas que se realizan allí y su gastronomía son muy concurridas, pues son típicas de la raza indígena en donde son bienvenidos visitantes de todo el país y el mundo. 
María se ha dedicado a la comercialización de textiles artesanales con estilos propios de los otavaleños como ponchos, bufandas, bolsos, actividad que aprendió de su familia desde hace 6 años y en la cual invierte 9 horas al día, por su experiencia y la de su familia se ha convertido en una excelente administradora de su negocio y ahora desea extender la oferta de mercadería a sus clientes comprando una variedad de productos que cumplan las expectativas de sus clientes, para lo cual solicitó un préstamo en Fundación Alternativa en donde también recibe capacitaciones para mejorar su servicio y entregar al cliente un valor agregado. Ella espera que sus ingresos mejoren para así estabilizarse económicamente y salir adelante con su hijo y los proyectos para su futuro.

loans.use: para comprar mercadería y surtir el negocio

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is 36 years old, married and a mother of four children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transport services.

Bushra is a clothes seller. She purchases clothes at wholesale prices and sells at retail to her clients to earn profits. She is very knowledgeable about the latest trends in fashion and her clients like her variety of clothes very much.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further improvement of her business. With the loan investment she will buy wider variety of clothes to increase her sales and income.

loans.use: To buy clothes for her clothes selling business

loans.name: Brakasu

texts.en: Brakisu sells wakye (rice and beans cooked together) and stew at Enyensudo. Brakisu has been selling wakye for the past five years. She is married to a mechanic and has two children. Brakisu assists her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of rice, beans and fish to prepare her food for sale. Brakisu will use her new profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, beans and fish to prepare her food for sale.

loans.name: Salimu

texts.en:
Salimu is 36 years old and lives in the town of Koboko in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has 7 children, 3 of whom are currently in school. For the past 9 years, Salimu has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells silver small fish. 

To help expand his business, Salimu has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more silver small fish, and the big size fish for resale. This will help Salimu generate greater profits, and pay the school fees for his children. Salimu hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand his business into a wholesale business. 

Salimu is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Salimu who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more silver small fish and the big size fish for resale.

loans.name: Lorn's Group

texts.en:
Lorn, 62, lives in a rural area of the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province, Cambodia, and has four children. To make a living, she has engaged in rice-farming and pig-raising for twenty-five years. She also supplemented her income by selling various kinds of vegetables to help the family generate income. 

She is able to earn about KHR 18,000 per day and manages to save about KHR 10,000 each day after offsetting daily expenses. Insufficient working capital is the main challenge for her current business. 

Lorn’s group consist of three members who live in the same village, and she is in her first loan with VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of KHR 300,000, while the remaining two members are requesting a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. As the leader, Lorn is going to utilize her portion as additional working capital in buying more vegetables for selling, such as cucumbers, cabbages, chilies, etc. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income from the current business so as to keep up good progress in her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for selling

loans.name: 23 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “23 DE MARZO”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Monica es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de verduras, tejido de mantas, venta de bañadores y baldes, venta de pipocas de maíz, venta de ropa coreana, costura de faldas, venta de coca.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Monica es integrante, ella indica que hace siete meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su suegra que es socia de la institución.  En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de coca que trabaja hace años atrás, cuenta que en la actualidad su familia desarrolla este cultivo en los Yungas y que ella lo trae  a La Paz para la venta.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de taqui de coca) que adquirirá de sus vecinas de su comunidad y posteriormente lo comercializará en los mercados autorizados. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank “23 de Marzo” will begin their second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the “Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación.”  It is composed of eight members and is directed by a board of directors where Monica is the treasurer.  The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied, among them:  vegetable sales, blanket weaving, sales of bath items, popcorn sales, Korean clothing sales, skirt sewing and the selling of coca.

The loan that they take out will benefit the small-business entrepreneurs where Monica is a member.  She explains that she joined Pro Mujer seven months ago, entering at the invitation of her mother-in-law who is a member of the institution.  At present she has a business selling coca that she has worked at for years.  She says that currently her family carries out this cultivation in the Yungas and that she brings it to La Paz to sell. 

The loan that she will take out now is for the increase of capital for the purchase of a “taqui” (equivalent to 50 pounds) of coca that she will acquire from her neighbors in her community and that she will subsequently sell in the authorized markets.  This form of work permits her to generate resources in order to support her family as much as possible, as she lives in a common-law marriage and has one child. 

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy a “taqui” of coca.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de repuestos de vehiculos pesados como estabilizadores,llantas,parabrisas entre otros repuestos,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tine 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de repuestos de vehiculos pesados.La socia solicita le credito para comprar llantas,parabrisas y estabilizadores.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.

loans.use: La socia solicita le credito para comprar llantas,parabrisas y estabilizadores.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando a sus difentes negocios como venta de chicha que es una bebida a base de maiz y atmbien vende productos de belleza y sigue ofreciendo servicios de telefonia,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora y por medio de estos pequeño negocios le va muy bien y puede sacar adelante a sus hijos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar maiz al por mayor para que prepare la chicha.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.

loans.use: La socia solicita el credito para comprar maiz al por mayor para que prepare la chicha.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: José tenía una sociedad junto a su padre en la venta de arroz y cerdos pero viendo que poco a poco iba mejorando se independizo. Su trabajo es tener que visitar a las tiendas del sector y vende a crédito. Unas de sus dificultades son el mal clima y la delincuencia. José está casado tiene hijos pero todos se independizaron  su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos. Con el préstamo va comprar arroz y cerdos.  Unas de sus aspiraciones desean mejorar su vivienda y una mejor vida para su hogar.
texts.en: José had a partnership with his father in the rice and pigs selling business, but seeing that his situation gradually improved, he became independent. His work is to visit the stores of the sector. He sells on credit. Some of the hardships he faces are bad weather and crime. José is married with children, but all his children are already independent, and his wife does household chores. With this loan he'll purchase rice and pigs. Some of his aspirations are to improve his home and his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase rice and pigs.

loans.name: Edwar Cesar

texts.es:
Edwar es un hombre de 41 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y su pareja, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, Edwar no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo.
Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, desde hace 5 años Edwar trabaja como maestro constructor, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por los buenos acabados que les da a sus construcciones.
Edwar se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de herramientas de construcciones, tales como: maderas para encofrado, cortadora de cerámica, carretas, entre otras; de esta manera Edwar podrá contar con los materiales necesario para realizar su labor, con ello espera poder aumentar sus servicios e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus padres, a quienes agradece toda la ayuda y cuidados brindados.
texts.en:
Edwar is 41 years old. He lives in Pisco, together with his parents and his life-partner whom he loves and are his reasons to strive in life. He is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person with a strong will to succeed. However, because he lacked economic resources and needed to work in order to help his parents, he was unable to study to become a professional, even though he would really like to.

With effort and dedication, Edwar has been working for five years as a general contractor. He starts working early every morning, and works for approximately twelve hours. He believes that he does well in his job because he is committed to it and because he delivers good quality constructions.

Edwar appreciates what Kiva lenders do, because thanks to their help he will be able to buy the construction tools he needs, including for example wood for formwork, a ceramic tile cutter, and wheelbarrows. This will facilitate Edwar’s work and he hopes to be able to provide more services and increase his income, which in turn will help him to provide his parents, to whom he is grateful for their help and care, with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction tools, such as wood for formwork, a ceramic tile cutter and wheelbarrows.

loans.name: El Mirador Group

texts.es:
Mario es el secretario del grupo “El Mirador” (en el video es el primero del lado izquierdo, que se presenta a los inversionistas Kiva), un grupo integrado por seis socios todos trabajadores y con muchas ganas de progresar.
Mario tiene 23 años, es soltero y estudia administración de negocios en la universidad.
Como es un joven muy emprendedor, Mario tenía muchas ganas de empezar su propio negocio. Así que, después de investigar la rentabilidad y demanda de algunos negocios, se decidió a empezar un negocio de lencería. Él compra los productos en un mercado mayorista y véndelos en su propia tienda. Solo empezó hace una semana pero está muy animado y creé que con este negocio va a conseguir ingresos suficientes para financiar sus estudios.
Mario invertirá el préstamo en la compra de productos de lencería para su negocio como medias, calcetines, mallas, ropa interior, etc.
El mayor sueño de Mario es terminar sus estudios en administración y tener un buen hogar y una buena familia. El pide a los inversionistas Kiva que apoyen a su negocio y a los negocios de otras personan que tengan ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mario Salvador is 66 years old and has three children.  He is a member of the group "El Mirador", which is made up of six members, all of whom are hard-working and have a great desire to get ahead.  

Mario Salvador has been making furniture with engineered wood for 35 years.  He builds closets, kitchen cabinets, shelves, etc.  This work has helped him support his family and cover the costs of educating his children.  He currently has a small workshop in his house, which he has expanded little by little.  

He would like to invest the loan in the purchase of engineered wood to make furniture that he already has on order.  In the photo, we can find Mario Salvador in the bottom right.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of engineered wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Francisco Tito

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre de 36 años, vive en la ciudad de Camaná con su esposa, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Francisco no pudo estudiar la carrera de Arquitectura que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta salir de pesca y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de su esposa, Francisco trabaja brindando servicios de transporte, él cuenta con pequeño auto el cual utiliza como taxi, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, recorriendo las diversas calles de su ciudad en búsqueda de pasajeros, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por el trato amable y respetuoso que brinda a sus clientes.
Francisco se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, él desea poder hacer el tarrajeo y puesta de piso de su hogar; de esta manera Francisco tendrá su vivienda en mejores condiciones, que brinden mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para que junto con su familia puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
Francisco is a 36 year old man who lives in the city of Camaná with his wife. He is a very friendly, hard working and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to excel. Unfortunately due to a lack of economic resources and the need to work to pay his bills, Francisco was not able to study the Architecture career that he wanted to. But he would have liked very much to have done so. In his free time he likes to go fishing and occasionally he cooks a tasty dish Chaufa rice to share with his family.

With a lot of hard work, dedication and the support of his wife, Francisco works offering a taxi transportation service. He has a small vehicle which he uses as a taxi. Every day from the early hours of the morning he starts work, travelling the diverse streets of the city looking for passengers. He works approximately 12 hours and believes that it is going well because of his friendly and respectful dealings with his customers.

Francisco is very grateful for the Kiva loans, as thanks to the help provided he will be able to make improvements to his house. He wants to do the floor and finishing of his house. In this way Francisco will have a house in better conditions, which will give more security to his family and improve their well-being. He will continue working and making an effort to get ahead, together with his family.

loans.use: to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Adriel

texts.es:
Adriel, de 64 años, es un hombre muy alegre y responsable, el es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene siete hijos mayores, vive en la casa heredada de sus padres junto a sus hermanos, sus hijos como ya son adultos tienen independencia, por ese motivo el vive únicamente con su pareja en la casa donde crío a todos sus hijos. El trabajo de Adriel es brindar servicio de vulcanizado a vehículos menores como motos y mototaxis. Tiene su taller instalado en su casa en donde también ha establecido su tienda de venta de repuestos en donde pone a la venta diversos artículos vehiculares como faros, rodajes, llantas, aros y espejos. Realiza labores como bajada de motor, cambio de rodajes, cambio de aceite, parchado de llantas entre otros. Ejecuta esta actividad desde hace 21 años y con ello pudo brindarles a sus hijos todo lo necesario para su crianza. Trabaja con el apoyo de dos de sus hijos quienes le ayudan a realizar algunas funciones y de esta manera cumple con su trabajo de manera óptima.  Lo que le gusta de su labor es que puede trabajar en la comodidad de su hogar además de hacerlo en compañía de sus hijos, se siente muy bien haciendo algo que le gustó desde muy joven y que ha ido mejorando con el paso de los años. Afortunadamente le va muy bien gracias a que su taller esta ubicado en una calle muy concurrida y cerca además a un depósito de vehículos lo cual le permite tener permanentemente una clientela muy fluida, espera que su negocio se mantenga con el mismo ritmo de progreso. Este es el crédito número 13 con MFP, está muy contento por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a continuar pagando puntualmente sus cuotas tal como le programen, está muy feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará repuestos para su venta además de algunos materiales para que pueda seguir con su trabajo de vulcanizado.

loans.use: comprará repuestos y piezas de vulcanizado.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 39 years old and lives in Aquino, Tangub City. She is married with four children. 

To earn a living, Arlene has a sari-sari store business. She earns about PHP 500 each month doing this type of work. Arlene has requested a loan to have additional capital for her sari-sari store.

Arlene has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Arlene would like to improve her living conditions through her business.

loans.use: to have additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 58 years old and lives in Polao, Tangub City. She is separated with three children. 

To earn a living, Pacita has a sari-sari (variety) store business. She earns about PHP 2000 each month doing this type of work. Pacita has requested a loan for her existing business.

Pacita has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Pacita would like to have a grocery store.

loans.use: to have additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Ascencion

texts.es: El señor Ascencion, es una persona de 47 años de edad de estado civil casado, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, vive en su casa propia, cuenta con cuatro dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus hijos; la actividad económica a la que se dedica es la producción agrícola; produce papa, haba, arveja y quinua en sus propios terrenos que cuentan con riego, las cuales se hallan situadas en la comunidad de Kañacota del municipio de Tíraque distante aproximadamente a unos 77 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba. Y finalmente el cliente y su esposa manifiestan tener ganas de seguir incrementando su producción agrícola y para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la compra de abono de gallinaza y semilla de papa certificada que son  insumos elementales para obtener un mejor rendimiento de este cultivo y del forma obtener mayores ingresos económicos que vayan a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y en un tiempo corto de los nietos que vayan a tener.
texts.en:
Asencion is a 47 year old man. He is married and only reached up to primary school. He lives in his own house and has four children who are economically dependent on him. He makes a living in agriculture; he produces potatoes, fava beans, peas and quinoa on his own land. His land is irrigated by flood water which are found in the Kanacota community of the Tiraque municipality, which is about 77 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba. 

The client and his wife say that they would like to continue increasing their agricultural production and see the need to request investment capital to buy hen fertilizer and potato seeds. These are supplies that are needed to obtain a better harvest for his crops and in this way obtain greater earnings which will go toward improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer (hen droppings) and potato seeds.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: Flora es socia del Banco Comunal Fuerza, tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera madre de 3 hijos, y socia de FINCA Perú desde hace mas de 6 meses. A Flora le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal por que se distrae y también porque la facilidad con la que obtiene los prestamos, también le gusta las capacitaciones porque le enseñan sobre la puntualidad, el ahorro, y tambien como educar a sus hijos y como manejar su negocio y sus ganancias. Flora solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de suministros para la elaboración de la cancha como: aceite, sal, maíz, etc.
texts.en: Flora is a partner of the Fuerza Communal Bank. She is a 30-year-old single mother of 3 children, and has been a member of FINCA Perú for over 6 months. Flora likes the communal bank meetings because they take her mind off things, and also because she can obtain loans easily there. She also enjoys the training sessions because they teach her about punctuality, saving money, how to bring up her children, and how to manage her business and profits. Flora is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of supplies to make cancha [a Peruvian dish of toasted corn kernels], such as cooking oil, salt, and corn.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, salt, and corn.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny es socia del Banco Comunal Fuerza, es conviviente y madre de 1 hijo, es socia de FINCA Perú más de 1 año, tiene su bodega, estando en Finca logró incrementar su mercadería, también aprendió a ahorrar y a manejar bien su negocio, donde sabe distribuir sus ganancias. Gracias a FINCA Peru pudo comprar los muebles de su casa. Marleny solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, rice, noodles, dried vegetables, and beverages.

loans.name: Serafina

texts.es: Serafina es socia del Banco Comunal Fuerza, tiene su negocio de venta de cuy y gallinas, también vende gelatina, gracias Finca Peru pudo mejorar en su negocio y aprendió a ser responsable y a ahorrar, cosa que no lo hacía antes, le gusta las capacitaciones que le dan porque le ayuda mucho en su negocio, a si como en su vida personal. Serafina solicita un prestamo que lo invertirá en la compra de cuyes y construirá galpones para la crianza de cuyes.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 25-year-old married man from Al Hashmi Amman Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 1,000 JOD to pay for items for marriage. He wants to buy furniture and households items for his home. He hopes in the future to improve his family living standard.

loans.use: to pay for items for marriage

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 61 years old and lives in Bintana Tangub City. Rosalina is married with 3 children. 

Rosalina has a shop that sells different types of products. Rosalina has had this business for 5 years years. Rosalina has requested a loan to have additional capital.

Rosalina has been a member of PMPC for 8 months.  In the future, Rosalina hopes to have a groceries.

loans.use: to have additional capital for her shop.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 60 years old and lives in Bocator. Lydia is widowed with two children.
 
Lydia has a shop that sells various types of products. She has had this business for three years. 

Lydia requested a loan to additional capital. Lydia has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to operate her own grocery store.

loans.use: Additional Capital
